Reviews.Title: “Building Refurbuishment Mrs L Littlejohn”
Reviews.Author: Lin L
Reviews.Content: After short notice of business meeting in Barcelona I booked the Gravina Hotel based on reviews. Staff very freindly and welcoming even the builders! champagne on arrival. Was given GAVINA II 5th floor, nice twin room but wall light made buzzing sound and flickered shower dribbled water unabble to wash hair!! at 9.45am the next morning the building works on the 4th floor began pneumatic drill under our bathroom. The staff moved us yes, but very inconvenient for 1 nightup hill and down dale to move but they should have notified us and asked if we would mind being in that part of the building. E 338 for two nights a bit steep!!

Reviews.Title: “Great Location, Great Hotel!”
Reviews.Author: Clare M
Reviews.Content: Booked this hotel before reading reviews and was quite worried as to what we would find when we got there after reading some reviews. Firstly, the hotel is in a great location, quiet side street and only 2 minutes from La Ramblas and Plaza Catalunya. The reception staff were very pleasant and accommodating. We booked a basic double room and although it was on the small side it had everything we needed, was spotlessly clean and looked as if it had just been refurbished. Beds were comfy and maid service every day. Fantastic choice for breakfast. No negatives, would definitely stay again and would recommend highly.

Reviews.Title: “This is the place to stay in Barca”
Reviews.Author: JMZB5F1
Reviews.Content: This is the hotel we selected for our second trip to Barça. well, contrarily to the hotel we went to during our first stay in Barça, i will have no negative points to express for this one. By the way , this 3 stars hotel costs us only 10 euros per day per person more than the 1 star hotel we booked the first time we came in Barça. and let me tell you something : the breakfast is GREAAAAT. Well , you cannot go twice , but as long as you stay in the breakfast room , you can eat all what you want. The rooms are quite nice, some fresh painting would be a nice to have. Close to everything : close the Plaça Catalunya , to "Las Ramblas" to Passeig de Gracia. Staff people are friendly , providing accurate information, providing the cheapest ones . when we will go back in Barça , we already know where we are going to go , we found our place : Gravina...

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel, location & value great.”
Reviews.Author: TonyC1965
Reviews.Content: We stayed at this hotel and I have to say the staff couldn't have been any better. The location is brilliant just enough away from the really noisy street, but only 2 minutes from Plaza Catalunya & Las Ramblas. The boys found it a real adventure trying to get to the hotel using different streets each day. Think we managed 9 different routes. The hotel was great value for money if you go direct. The hotel was very clean. The buffet breakfast was fine and kids loved having chocolate donuts for breakfast. We were in a triple room (Room 201) the view out back wasn't nice (kept curtains shut) but we only used the room to sleep in and a base. So many great places to see why would you even think of staying in? Have already recommended this hotel to a friend going in April.

Reviews.Title: “Uncomfortable”
Reviews.Author: Libby3589
Reviews.Content: The staff were very friendly and helpful, however I would never return and would not recommend this hotel. The beds were solid and made for a very uncomfortable nights sleep. We woke up on two occasions to find the room stank of the sewers/drains although our windows were closed. Our hot water had next to no pressure so having a shower was a lengthy process, having a bath. Even longer. If you're looking for somewhere with a comfortable bath you can lay down in, don't come here. I don't think it was even 4ft in length. Food choice was very limited, breakfast was poor with jam that was as runny as water. Slightly suprised to see donuts offered for breakfast although I won't lie, I did have one for breakfast one morning. On arrival we were asked to come back at 1pm when our rooms would be ready. We came back at 3pm and our rooms were still not ready. We had to wait a further 30 minutes before we could get in. Brilliant location in terms of sightseeing as only just around the corner from the top of Las Ramblas.

Reviews.Title: “One night pre-cruise but would strongly consider longer future stay.”
Reviews.Author: Kenam
Reviews.Content: Just around the corner to the Plaza Catalunya with all its big stores, restaurants, bars and excellent transport links. Very clean, welcoming, with efficient reception staff and perfectly acceptable breakfast included in the price!

Reviews.Title: “Convenient base in Barcelona”
Reviews.Author: metromama
Reviews.Content: The best thing about this hotel is its excellent location in Barcelona being a 5 minute walk to Catalunya Square and 100m to the nearest Metro. If you are taking the Aerobus from the airport (recommended), you can get off at Universitat stop and its a mere 100m to the hotel. We had a deluxe room on the first floor which had a separate sitting area but unfortunately had an interleading door to the next room so it was quite noisy. On arrival we were offered a welcome glass of sparkling wine. We were very pleasantly surprised by the good breakfast selection. The hotel staff were friendly and helpful. There is a nice little bar area with a few dining tables where you can have a drink and snack. Two annoyances: the wireless internet did not work very well in the room; and there are very few coathangers and those are ridiculous ones that you can never get off the rail. However there's 2 pcs in the reception area and a printer which you can use anytime free of charge and there's a very good Chinese shop nearby if you want to buy some plastic throw away hangers. The beds are comfy and bathroom has power shower over the bath as well as magnifying shaving/make up mirror. There are two plug points in the bathroom to recharge your cell phone/camera/laptop.

Reviews.Title: “great welcome to barceolna”
Reviews.Author: elizabeth t
Reviews.Content: we stayed here for 4 days and I have to say it was excellent! The welcome was warm and the staff on reception were very friendly and helpful. The room was lovely ,plenty of space and very clean. The breakfast was an ideal start to the day, lots of choice hot and cold selection that wasnt rushed nothing was too much bother to staff! I would recommend this hotel very highly! thank you for wonderful holiday.

Reviews.Title: “Good choice for a 3 star hotel in Europe”
Reviews.Author: MTL9
Reviews.Content: This was the first time that we have booked into a 3 star hotel in Europe and didn't dare to expect very much from it. To our surprise, we were pleasantly surprised when both our rooms were big. We had a quadruple and a triple room. One of the rooms were situated at the club/grand (?) wing and the other on the normal wing. Both rooms were big and I am happy that we communicated with the hotel prior to our arrival. Breakfast has a good selection.of choices. Location is good - a stone throw away from Placa Catalunya, Universitat, La Rambla, Porta d'el Angel - shopping street! Aerobus to/fro airport is just round the corner! Staff are polite and helpful. No regrets booking this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Great staff, perfect location”
Reviews.Author: ejlens
Reviews.Content: Very friendly and helpfull staff. Great location in the heart of the city. I got a bottle of champagne from them as it was my birthday during my stay there! How cool is that?

Reviews.Title: “Fabulous location”
Reviews.Author: AppyTravels
Reviews.Content: I have nothing but good things to say about this hotel. It was well located, just a 5 minute walk to Catalunya Place, a major shopping street. Port Vell was about a 15 minute walk away, unless you get caught up in all the alleyways of shops. The staff were extremely helpful and kind. There are so many places to eat around the hotel. The breakfast was fantastic and the room was perfect during our stay. Just what we needed in Barcelona. A big plus is that the Aerobus takes you directly from Catalunya Place to the airport and there is a bus every 5 mins. You really can't fault this place. Thanks Grupotel Gravina!

Reviews.Title: “very bad hotel centrally located but friendly staff”
Reviews.Author: gerhard r
Reviews.Content: If you want a centrally located hotel its perfect! BUT rooms are very small, bathrooms are worn out and very old and not very clean. the walls of the room are super thin and you could hear lots of noises from the staff and the guests. the bfst was quiet alright for a 3star hotel. the superior room is not wort the rate you pay. you can get better deals in better hotels in bcn. the only positive aspect is that the staff is very friendly and helpful. but this all does not compensate the rest of the hotel. never would recommend or even stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “Not much larger than a closet”
Reviews.Author: Travelsrandom
Reviews.Content: The room was nicely appointed, but beyond small - I understand European rooms for singles offer just a single bed, but the bathroom was actually larger than the bedroom- They offer minimal services in the hotel - They have a "bar" if you will, with 3 seats - The staff was ok. The location was very close to Las Ramblas, that was probably the best of this hotel. The am breakfast was included and offered a great variety of foods.

Reviews.Title: “dreadful hotel”
Reviews.Author: FloWarwickshire
Reviews.Content: I'm in full agreement with the review by Buck8444, we had booked two nights in this hotel, think we had the same room. My husband hit his head on the shelf and every time he turned over he switched the lights on because with no room for a bedside table they had been fitted into the head board, when I turned over I knocked my knees on the wall. This was never a double room,a single at best. The curtains were drawn back to reveal a wall and drain pipes. The bathroom was large but the rim of the toilet was encrushed with black.The breakfast was pathetic, and overhaul the hotel was dusty and in need of refurbishment.We booked out the next day

Reviews.Title: “Needs Help”
Reviews.Author: Davis H
Reviews.Content: It was our first visit to Barcelona so we selected the hotel based on location and the description that it was an old converted mansion. The 3 star rating was a flag but we have had great experiences at other 3 star hotels. The two elevator rides to our room were----interesting---as the elevators are about the size of a broom closest. Our view was a brick wall and the room was smaller than anticipated and no storage for our clothes. Just a closest to hang clothes, no chest or drawers of any type. Also, no bathrobes as advertised on their web site and no one seemed to know anything about it. Breakfast came with the room. It definitely needs help. Uninspired breakfast foods, lousy scrambled eggs, uncooked bacon, sugar cereals. And, the best part. Left a 6AM wake up call on the day of our departure as we had a 7:45AM transfer to the airport. We got the wake up call at 7:45 when our transfer showed up, not at 6:00AM as requested. When questioned, the desk clerk advised my name was not on the list. Mmmmm, strange as I saw the evening clerk put our name on the wake up call list the night before. Definitely not recommended. Have to be able to do better than this.

Reviews.Title: “Not recommended - not even for one night.”
Reviews.Author: Jannetto
Reviews.Content: We booked this hotel for one night on the 21st Oct before our cruise on the 22nd. On arrival at 11am we knew that we were too early to check in and we acknowledged that to reception but asked could we leave our suitcases in reception. The receptionist agreed and told us to come back at 12.15 when our room would be ready. When we arrived back (after 1pm) another individual was covering reception, who informed us that actually our room was not ready and he could not tell us when it would be ready!!!! This was despite my reservation confirming checking in available from 1pm. So, off we went wandering again did not arrive back to the hotel till after 4pm. Finally, we were checked in. Based on the positive reviews and the price paid for a standard room with breakfast I expected a small, basic but clean room with a reasonably comfortable bed to enjoy a good nights sleep before our cruise. Unfortunately the grim reality fell some way short of that. On unlocking our door the room was certainly small as I had expected, but was also badly in need of redecoration - the wall paint was filthy in areas. The view was abysmal - not so much 'internal courtyard' as a tall wall and fence blocking out all light. The room was also a weird layout - imagine if you will a square divided in four - top left hand is bed, bottom left hand is desk with TV, top right hand is wardrobe, bottom left hand is small sofa. It was not possible to watch TV while sitting or lying on the bed. I guess I could have overlooked these things if I had managed to get a good nights sleep, but unfortunately much of our night was disturbed by music, shouting and yelling from some function room nearby, and this went on into the early hours. Our bed was also hard as a rock, with one pathetic thin pillow each. It was not possible to sit up or to prop oneself up on the bed comfortably either, hence the TV issue. In summary, I spent the most uncomfortable night of my life at this place. I thought that at least we would be able to enjoy a decent breakfast before we set off for the port. There too I was mistaken. Breakfast was a collection of singularly unappetizing items such as a burnt and congealed mess of scrambled eggs .... Bacon which was 90% fat and 10% bacon. Etc. etc. Even the cereal was revolting - cheap stuff saturated with sugar. Thankfully we were only there one night - if any longer I would have had to move to another hotel. Next time we stay in Barcelona I will pay more to experience a basic level of comfort and some decent breakfast.

Reviews.Title: “Poor customer service”
Reviews.Author: Jose R
Reviews.Content: This is my first time in this hotel. On arrival, I havent been given the basic info that you normally get, such as the location of the breakfast room, best times to eat, etc. Also not been offered the glass of champagne as mentioned on their web page. The rooms are quite small and lack of natural lighting, although fairly clean. Unfortunately During breakfast I had to ask for glasses for the juice, the hot buffet was almost empty. The layout of the rom is not very practical as there is a lot of guests and staff moving about. While I was helping myself at the buffet the waiter cleared my table to seat other people. So not very pleasant. The staff focus on clearing tables, no attention to the guests needs. If you stay above the 3rd floor, you must change lifts, walking the corridors and steps to get another lift, so with luggage is not very easy. The best feature of the hotel is the location. As the first impression says it all, I wouldnt comeback again to this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Two day pre cruise stay”
Reviews.Author: billys19
Reviews.Content: Staff very helpful, room clean. Bed a bit hard for us. Had to change lifts at floor two, go up a staircase (see photo) and get a second smaller lift. No problem after we had our luggage in the room. We saw some of the standard rooms and these are small with the bed against the wall. We upgraded to a superior room and were pleased that we had. There is a few euros charged for the room safe.

Reviews.Title: “well-situated, big differences among the rooms, go for the superior”
Reviews.Author: IsidoraS
Reviews.Content: I stayed several times in this hotel. It's difficult to evaluate it as a whole, because some rooms are nice while others definitely aren't. To be avoided are the single rooms (which I suppose are also sometimes counted as double; anyway, those at cheapest rate): it's not just that the room is very small, but they don't get any natural light because the "windows" open on an air shaft. But superior rooms can be nice, like a few of those in the annex that even have a little patio. The hotel is well-located (midway between Plaça Catalunya and MACBA). Breakfast is so-and-so: pretty bad coffee (served lukewarm), artificial juice, but on the other hand, nice selection of fruits, hams, cheese and pastries. Internet connection tends to break down often.

Reviews.Title: “Good, Clean hotel close to main attractions”
Reviews.Author: TheRealG-Man
Reviews.Content: First, the location is great: only a few blocks to the Plaza de Catalunya, where you can catch the subway to get anywhere, walk Las Ramblas or walk to the Gaudi houses. The restaurant across the street is great. The hotel is clean and functional. I would not say luxurious. Our room had four beds which was perfect. The beds were comfortable and the linens clean. The bathroom was quite nice. Our room was reasonably quiet. The elevator is tiny, the four of us would not fit with luggage, but that was a minor inconvenience. Hotel staff was friendly and helpful. The hotel is in a safe part of town and there is a security person at the front of the hotel. Breakfast was great - good variety, and very good quality food.

Reviews.Title: “A safe bet”
Reviews.Author: phinaeus
Reviews.Content: Booked this hotel because it was central and we had a disabled companion. Excellent choice. Rooms comfortable; staff friendly and though excellent english tolerated and corrected my poor spanish with smiles; plenty of choice with breakfast - you can eat enough to last the day. Location ideal as about 200m from P.Catalunya in a quiet side street with plenty of choice of tappas bars/ restaurants within the same distance. We will use this hotel again when visiting barcelona.

Reviews.Title: “What's to moan about?”
Reviews.Author: goesawayalot
Reviews.Content: No problems with this hotel whatsoever. The staff were excellent, didn't come across even one grumpy member - there's usually at least one if not more. The young lad on reception was especially pleasant and very helpful. No problem with finding our room either. We were on the 5th floor and didn't have to change lifts or anything like that. As for complaints about the standard rooms being too small - what do these people want? Its no different to any other 3 star room that i've ever been in anywhere else in the world. Twin beds, dressing table/desk, chairs, wardrobes, table, bathroom (not tiny). TV, mini-bar, trouser press. I cant think of anything else I would expect to find including the size of it.The location is excellent for La Ramblas and Placa de Catalunya and the price is reasonable for somewhere in this area, I think Barcelona is quite an expensive city anyway and I booked this hotel because of good reviews and because of the price. I would definitely recommend this hotel to friends and family.

Reviews.Title: “excellent”
Reviews.Author: sivalKent
Reviews.Content: excellent , first time i have been to a hotel without grumbling to the reception about anything. very friendly staff and helpful. Room lovely and clean and breakfast very good. If we return to Barcelona again this hotel will be our first choice, We used the hotel for 2 nights before joining a cruise, Hotel is 2 minutes from las ramblas , All i can say is excellent

Reviews.Title: “Too many problems”
Reviews.Author: Carol F
Reviews.Content: Getting to our room involved 2 elevators with steps in between which was difficult even with wheeled luggage. The room was hot and getting help to adjust the air was the second problem. We declined the breakfast because the price per person was twice as much as what we paid in a 4* hotel. They also demanded full payment for our two nights before we even saw the room. The room was small, but quiet and clean, however there was no soap or other supplies. The location was good, but next trip, I will pay more for a better location and more service.

Reviews.Title: “choose a superior room!”
Reviews.Author: Jef-myriam
Reviews.Content: we stayed 3 nights in Gravina and were quite happy about it. The room was big enough (suite type), clean bathroom and a terrace. Service was perfect: very friendly and professional. Welcome drink was a nice plus. Breakfast was impeccable; don't come late though if you want avoid overcrowded room. Some comment only: we had asked for a quiet room and were given one on the top floor, right under a noisy air conditioner. Fortunately the thing stopped buzzing around midnight. Also the layout of the hotel is a bit confusing first. The biggest plus of this hotel is the location; further is gives good value for money - but choose an upgrade to superior room if you think the standard room is too crampy!

Reviews.Title: “great location.”
Reviews.Author: chewpk
Reviews.Content: In the heart of the city, perfect location. The rooms were small,however the location and the extremly helpful staff made up for it. Will highly recommend to anyone

Reviews.Title: “Top Spot”
Reviews.Author: Gimmemoresun
Reviews.Content: We stayed here overnight before embarking our cruise ship. Very efficient check-in and nice gesture of welcome drink in bar. Room very small but adequate for a one-night stay and very good location. Would definitely stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Great location, a little bit expensive for a 3-stars hotel”
Reviews.Author: igorek
Reviews.Content: Pros: 1. Great location - one minute from metro station and couple minutes walking to plaza Catalunia and La Rambla 2. Great selection and variety of the breakfast buffet - one of the best 3. Nice customer service at the reception Cons: 1. Paper thin walls - you need earplugs at night 2. A/C is not regulated: only on/off switch. 3. They charge 2.16 euros per day for the safe in your room 4. Rooms are old and a little worn down; only a few toiletries 5. It's a solid 3-stars hotel, but expensive- I paid ~$142 with taxes on orbitz.com. I paid ~30% less for a real 4-stars hotels in both downtown Madrid or Sevilla ( but without breakfast)

Reviews.Title: “Very good hotel”
Reviews.Author: Ansiam
Reviews.Content: A very good hotel in a perfect location. 3 minutes walking from la ramblas and 1 minute for metro station. The staff were very helpfull and friendly. The room was clean and was kept clean all days. Breakfast was nice with a variety of food provided. If i visit barcelona again i will definetely stay at this hotel again.

Reviews.Title: “Noisy room 220”
Reviews.Author: BirgitteRamsoe
Reviews.Content: Overall a very nice, modern hotel with good location for a Barcelona family trip. We had the complimentary bubbles (cava) upon arrival, waiting for our room to get ready - and even cava and chocolate cake delivered to our room at our son's birthday. Breakfast buffet is plentiful and quite good. However, try to avoid room 220 (in Gravina II) which we (2 adults, 2 children) stayed in. Noise from the lift system (could be from adjacent building?) was almost constant until the wee hours and starting early morning again and even good earplugs didn't help. On Friday evening a lot af noise from closeby party/conference room - but at least that stopped.

Reviews.Title: “Never again....not a good experience”
Reviews.Author: CherylJax
Reviews.Content: nice touch with champagne upon arrival - The room itself looked ok and was clean, beds fairly comfortable. However, we had to haul our luggage up a bunch of stairs (as previously noted in other reviews). Then, noooo air conditioning. When we complained that it wasn't working, they brought us a tiny fan - not happy. We were on the busy street side, so had to have windows open, so no one slept that night. I was not happy with this hotel at all and would not stay again.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent location and a well kept hotel”
Reviews.Author: MaddeM
Reviews.Content: The staff was very nice and helpful at the reception. Room and bathroom were spacious and housekeeping cleaned it everyday, every night when I returned to the room it looked liked I just had arrived. There was some noise through out the night from the corridors but it is a hotel for groups, I mostly saw huge groups of kids. The room was situated far away in a another building and the two lifts I had to use were really slow if working at all. Also it was very hard to find and I did get regularly lost because the signs were a bit misleading (or non existing). Breakfast was very busy for the last 60-90 minutes even on weekdays but if you go there before the groups of teenagers storm it you'll find the staff there too very pleasant and helpful. The food was really good and it varied a little bit from day to day which was really nice. Loved the cakes!

Reviews.Title: “Ticked all the boxes”
Reviews.Author: Damfussy
Reviews.Content: This is a well situated hotel, 2 minutes from Plaça de Catalunya, 2 minutes from 2 metro stations, and main bus stops & 5 minutes from La Rambla. My single room had a good sized bed and although not facing the front, I was able to have my window wide open to allow cooling breezes into the room. The bathroom was excellent & included a bidet & large bath towels as standard.Breakfast was adequate, though not exciting, and the staff were extremely helpful always. A useful extra is the free use of a bathroom to use after you have checked out of your room, great if you have a later flight.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent hotel”
Reviews.Author: scruffyent
Reviews.Content: wonderful hotel very central to all you need. staff, especially Ruben on reception, very friendly. Good idea to have glass of Cava on arrival, went down a treat. Stayed for three nights with friends and will be back. Tina

Reviews.Title: “great location, very quiet which was great, tiny room not so great and bed hard as nails”
Reviews.Author: gyork
Reviews.Content: the hotel is situated in a great spot just off ramblas, very quiet the trip to the room was fun, into the tiny lift (not enough room for me and suitcases), then along corridors and up more stairs and into another tiny lift, eventually get there and the room was soooo small, but hey we were there to see the sights not stay in the room air conditioning is really good, breakfast good (included in my booking), service from staff was excellent beds were hard as nails, pity

Reviews.Title: “Perfect location; perfect service”
Reviews.Author: 22melimelo
Reviews.Content: The hotel's location and staff were ideal. Imagine being greeted with a glass of Cava while checking in, and having central Barcelona steps away (Universitat Metro station), with the advantage of sleeping on a quiet side street. The room was small and basic, but we didn't go to Barcelona to spend time in a hotel room. The staff were extremely friendly, helpful and accomodating. If you're looking for luxury, this isn't it; if you're looking for a welcoming hotel that's walking distance to everything you'll want to see, this is it. We stayed 6 nights and wouldn't hesitate to go back.

Reviews.Title: “well located hotel”
Reviews.Author: dottylou
Reviews.Content: this hotel was very well located down a little side street which meant it was fairly quiet. Very clean and comfortable, the reception staff were very helpful, we were given rooms opposite our friends, very thoughtful. I was desperate for a cuppa, the hotel loan out a kettle attached to a tray for free ( you have to pay 3E per day for the coffee/tea etc) this was ideal. The twin bed room was a good size with large wardrobe and 2 extra chairs. bathroom and balcony.

Reviews.Title: “very nice”
Reviews.Author: theking3474
Reviews.Content: Stayed for 3 nights in in Feb 2011, first visit to Barcelona, Hotel is ideally located 5 Mins walk from La Rambla, Nice clean hotel, Very helpful satff, room was a little small and the room door could have fitted better, otherwise I can't fault the stay. Just some advice for those travelling to Barcelona for the first time, use the the Aeorbus from the airport and back, lot cheaper than a taxi!

Reviews.Title: “Dreadful...stay somewhere else!!!”
Reviews.Author: traveller77_10
Reviews.Content: I have just got back TODAY (Friday) and felt the need to write a review straight away. We arrived on Monday and after being ignored by the woman behind the desk were allocated a room in the older part of the hotel. We went up to the room and as soon as I walked into the room I felt like crying. It was extremely dark, boiling and tiny. The bed was barely a double and was pushed up against the wall at one side, over the top of the other side was a shelf which meant that you couldn't at anypoint sit up in bed. When we sat on the bed it was rock hard and when my partner lay on the bed I was left a small area. This would have meant I would have lay on my side all night to fit, this is rather worrying as my parner is an average size man - not overweight. The rest of the room was grim to say the least, no space to move and extremely tired looking. At one point my OH attempted to open the wardrobe and the door basically came off the rails. There was almost no natural light, just a small window which opened on to a lightwell which looked out onto a wall. I stood trying to look out of the high window and commented about how it reminded me of prison scenes. At this point my OH decided to go downstairs to complain. He said he was dealt with quickly and the woman on reception didn't seem too suprised. We were then allocated a room in the newer part of the hotel and told thats all they had available. To get to the new part we had to go up 2 floors in 1 lift, go along another corridor into a newer bit, go up 8 steps (dragging our cases), then along another winding corridor and then into a tiny old fashioned lift for another 2 floors. We then eventually found our rooms. No one at any point offered to help us to our rooms or to carry our cases, despite the fact there seemed to be a doorman and it was a maze. When we got the next room it was still small but was brighter (still with a window out to a lightwell and a view of walls), the lay out was better in that the bed was slightly bigger and not pushed up against the wall. However it was boiling again, so we left our stuff and asked reception to sort out the heat (I was bright red at this point from the excessive heat in the rooms). They did sort the heating out, but we had to leave the AC on all the time, which was noisy and spat out stone/ dirt throughout the day/ night. The new room was okay, however it was extremely noisy apart from the AC - there were 2 building sites either side of the hotel which meant that you needed to leave your room from 9am-5pm. It was just as bad and at night. You could hear everything, the noisy lift, people walking and talking, none stop banging, etc. I could hear the people next door using the toilet and the lady must have been very ill because she was throwing up each morning we were there. I have concluded the walls must be made of cardboard! We paid for breakfast when we booked our room, which was grim and was meant to be 15 euros each...lets just say it wasn't worth it and I actually felt sick after eating, we didn't even bother going one morning as we couldn't face it. All in all a terrible hotel, the staff never asked if we had enjoyed our stay as we checked out...hopefully because they were too embarrassed!!!!!! If I could have got some money back from the hotel I would have happily gone elsewhere, even a hostel would have been better! Before you book this hotel make sure you check out the photos on here in the poor and terrible ratings from previous unfortunate people who stayed there, you will soon understand what I am talking about.

Reviews.Title: “Superb, central hotel with efficient friendly staff”
Reviews.Author: SuzanneandMark
Reviews.Content: Hotel was about 200 yards from Las Ramblas and Placa Catalunya and was very quiet. Room was a superior and was a good size (not much extra cost but after reading reviews about some room sizes was well worth it) with a great view of the Christmas lights down to the Placa Catalunya from the small balcony. Staff were helpful and efficient, it was my husbands 40th and they kindly surprised us with a bottle of Cava, some cake and a card. Buffet breakfast was lovely with a good choice and all areas of hotel were clean and comfortable. Barcelona is a fabulous vibrant city and surprisingly warm in December! The open top sightseeing bus was a must and I would recommend a 2 day ticket for value as you can hop on and off both tours at your leisure.

Reviews.Title: “Nice Staff but lousy room”
Reviews.Author: AndyFromHorley
Reviews.Content: I was very impressed with the welcome from the staff, complimentary glass of champagne on arrival and the hotel is very close to P.Catalunya and La Rambla. Didn't have breakfast but looked in and it looked ok. The room was reasonable with a typical bathroom. Cleanliness was fine and the room was made up nicely each day. There was a safe in the room which required paying extra for a key. The problem I had was the lack of air-conditioning. The room was very warm indeed but there was no cooling facility. The thermostat had a sign above it stating that it was NOT a thermostat but a switch. Turning it one way turned on hot air from a vent in the ceiling - the other way turned off air from the ceiling. So the only way to cool the room was to open the balcony doors. In the middle of Barcelona this meant that there was a lot of noise. I mentioned this to the staff who just said that was how it was. As much as I liked the hotel and the location, this is a fatal flaw.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent hotel”
Reviews.Author: Cher2011
Reviews.Content: Stayed at the Grupotel for an anniversary for 2 nights, was expecting an average hotel considering the price but was very pleased with the quality, the room was huge (more like a suite) with a gorgeous bathroom. Rooms were very clean and towels etc changed daily. Location is good also, the main Rambla of barcelona being a couple of minutes walk away, but it is far enough away that it is quiet at night. Metro station is also 2 minutes away from the hotel. Perfect trip. Advice would be to get the blue aerobus from the station the hotel is a 5 minute walk away from where the bus stops and is only 5 euros pp. When in barcelona definately visit the market on saturday morning - found some lovely christmas presents take a trip to the square just off the rambla some nice restuarants serving pialla and for the boys definately a trip to barcelonas stadium.

Reviews.Title: “same high quality”
Reviews.Author: claretsfan
Reviews.Content: Just got back from my second but my husbands first stay at Grupotel Gravina. (Booked as Surprise birthday treat for my husband.) Same excellent welcome as before. Nothing too much trouble. Staff really helpfull. Requested tea/coffee making facilities and these were in the room in less than 5minutes. On returning from day out on the day of my husbands birthday we were greated with birthday greatings from the reception staff and on return to our room found bottle of Cava and chocolate cake waiting for us. Will deffinately stop again.Our two sons are hoping to go to Barcelona next year and will cetainly recomend that they stop here. Central to all main attractions restaurants and bars.

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel”
Reviews.Author: cdough6645
Reviews.Content: After a high speed AVE train ride (quite pleasurable) from Seville to Barcelona, we were met by the desk clerk with a glass of champagne and a packet of material highlighting the city and the do's and don't while staying in Barcelona. All the staff - from the doorman to the clerks to the maids were extremely friendly, outgoing and helpful. The breakfast buffet was fantastic! The hotel, with balconies for each room, borders Bari Gotic and is on a safe and quiet side street a few blocks from Placa de Catalunya Square and the top of Las Ramblas. Great for access to the Touristic buses! As we had an early flight out the last day which necessitated us missing breakfast the staff provided us with a 'box' breakfast with coffee! Great place! (My/my wife's opinion - spend more time in Barcelona and less in Madrid. Barcelona is much more beautiful, interesting, friendly and has much more character!)

Reviews.Title: “excellant base”
Reviews.Author: rich060
Reviews.Content: excellant base for the hub of the city,clean very friendly,would go back,breakfast was highly commended also the bar.

Reviews.Title: “Great Location, Good hotel”
Reviews.Author: sandrap009
Reviews.Content: A nice hotel on a quiet street near metros, buses, restaurants, and tourists areas. The rooms were nice but small, my bathroom was almost as big as the room. The staff was helpful but I wouldn't say overly friendly. I had a problem with my phone which they promptly took care of until the problem was solved. (It took 2-3 times until we figured out what the problem was.) The only thing I didn't like was that I was in the second part and I had to take two elevators and walk some long hallways and it was a little uncomfortable at times since I was by myself and noone was around.

Reviews.Title: “Good hotel - with certain reservations!”
Reviews.Author: Magnus45
Reviews.Content: We booked the hotel on the net - not through a travel agent. We were most surprised that they demanded full payment for our stay on arrival at the reception desk. We are all very well travelled senior citizens and found this request rather strange - in fact it was the first time it had happened to any of us. We queried this and we settled for 50% of the bill. If we had been aware of this before booking we might not have chosen to stay there. Apart from the above bit of annoyance we found the staff very agreeable and helpful. Breakfast was excellent and the dining room clean & presentable. The rooms, 301 and 302, are VERY small. The archatraves around the bathroom door were disintegrating due to water ingress. The rooms were quiet but the outlook was a bit grim - overlooking local patios etc. - a small price to pay for peace & quiet Locality was excellent. I would add photos but my camera was stolen on our last day there - the joys of visiting Barcelona!

Reviews.Title: “brilliant location and very helpful staff”
Reviews.Author: batezy Posted by an OctopusTravel traveler
Reviews.Content: we stayed for 3 nights and very pleased with the room,it was a triple room and it had a balcony. The rooms were very clean and tidy. I would definately stay at this hotel again and would strongly recommend it. Kevin from Shropshire

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel & Location”
Reviews.Author: MickLeeds
Reviews.Content: Just back from 4 nights can't fault hotel or staff. OK the rooms are a tad small but you know what you are getting if like me you booked the petite double. Main thing clean and tidy. Location just a stroll away from the ramblas but tucked away from the hustle and bustle. If you get chance get to see a game at the Camp nou.................awesome

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel fab location”
Reviews.Author: sally_alaister
Reviews.Content: Stayed here for 5 nights at the begining of Aug. To be honest I read reviews after we booked and I was a little worried. I need not have been. Our room was a great size, very clean it was on the 5th floor and very quiet.. We did notice some rooms that had doors open that were being cleaned appeared quite small, maybe it's a case of what you pay for. Breakfast was great lots of choice. The staff were very friendly nothing too much trouble. Location of the hotel could't be better very close to the centre but in a quiet street. Would definately stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “How small can a room be?”
Reviews.Author: tedsterandmumanddad
Reviews.Content: Plus points: Great location, cava on arrival, good breakfast (what was left), decent price, helpful reception staff and clean room/bathroom. Luggage kept when we had checked-out of hotel. Shower room readily available. Negative points: Very small room (404), the bed was pushed against the wall and there were just a few inches, enough to just walk around the other sides. No balcony, just a small window, no view, only other buildings, very clausterphobic. Over-zealous breakfast clearing away breakfast before 11am. Breakfast is served until 11am as we were told, but most things had already been cleared. On saying that, the breakfast was nice. Shower room provided (as we flew late in the day) was unbearably hot, even though the window was open. Room very very small, no good for a family.

Reviews.Title: “Return visit - even better second time around!”
Reviews.Author: Flight_0017
Reviews.Content: This was my second stay at the Grupotel Gravina. Upon arrival, I was asked if I'd stayed at the hotel before. When I confirmed that I had, I was welcomed back, and upgraded from a regular room to an executive room. The room turned out to be in the new part of the hotel, in the top floor. When I opened the door to the room, I was stunned to discover that it came with a huge, private patio! The room was small, but the patio definitely made up for it. Also, as a special treat, there was a knock on my door, and when I opened there was a smiling member of the staff who gave me a plate with a piece of chocolate cake on it, along with a card welcoming me back to the hotel. If I have to comment on something negative, it would have to be the airconditioning. It was positioned in a way that made sleeping with it switched on a bit uncomfortable. Also, the WI-FI kept disconnecting, but that might as well have been my computer's fault. I don't really plan on going back to Barcelona again, but if I ever do, I will stay at the Gravina again.

Reviews.Title: “Friendly, clean, helpful & good location = our favorite.”
Reviews.Author: barbaragtravels2010
Reviews.Content: We were welcomed with a free glass of champagne and peanuts after a long tiring trip and were amazed. The staff was professional and helpful and spoke English well yet indulged my desire to practice Spanish. The room was clean, the shower had good water pressure and warm water. We spent little time in the room so although it was huge we were fine with it. The location was convenient and we walked almost everwhere in the city from here. I would definitely recommend it as a great deal for the price if you are budget minded. We were able to print out our boarding passes at the free computer in the lobby area. My sister and I didn't eat breakfast here so no comment about that aspect. Right now I suggest that you skip the interior of Sagrada Familia as the interior construction noise is horrid. La Rambla is just a shopping district with lots of souvenir sidewalk shops. Barcelona has wonderful museums and architecture including the Museo de Catallunya which is quietly interesting as is Mont Juic with a couple museums as well. We would like to return and and Grupotel Gravina is where we would stay for sure.

Reviews.Title: “Hotel with very friendly staff!”
Reviews.Author: Miarka
Reviews.Content: This hotel has so friendly and helpful staff, and the location is very good. There are nice bakeries near the hotel. The rooms were spacious and clean, and we even had a balcony with table & 2 chairs :) The walls were though quite thin, and there was weird noises in the evening (like someone was moving furniture upstairs). Good value for money. And free internet access down at the lobby!

Reviews.Title: “A VERY small room!”
Reviews.Author: Fatbird1
Reviews.Content: This hotel is relatively central to the city, but the room was so small we could hardly turn around. I think the room was about 24 inches beyond the bed on all three sides! On the plus side, however, it was very clean and the bathroom was terrific (white marble and good, hot water). We easily walked to the main shopping street, and found plenty of restaurants near by. Another big plus was the free use of their computers (they have two) in the lobby for checking email, and very helpful advice from the employees. We chose it for a low price and we were not disappointed.

Reviews.Title: “Small room but nice bathroom”
Reviews.Author: twentysixfive
Reviews.Content: Hotel staff were not very friendly but the glass of cava on arrival was a nice touch. Room and bathroom were small but clean. Would stay there again for a short trip.

Reviews.Title: “Adequate”
Reviews.Author: joe_richards2427
Reviews.Content: Positives: Excellent location. Fantastic and helpful and fluent-in-English staff. Always clean - bedrooms and bathrooms. Great meals. Great service in the bar and restaurant. Negatives: Tiny, very cramped rooms. VERY, VERY noisy - the walls and wooden floors hold no sound in. Absence of expected Cava Wine on arrival. Beds were hard as rocks.

Reviews.Title: “best hotel for location”
Reviews.Author: marly26
Reviews.Content: were do you get champagne on arrival and a very friendly welcome ? after sipping our drink we took the lift to our 1st floor twin room ,it was very clean and had also a 2seater sofa for us to sit on. bathroom was spacious and had a hairdryer .there was a mini bar but it was expensive. I would highly recommend the breakfast when booking there was so much to choose from . The location was the best ever only 4/5 min to las ramblas and loads of shop near by. i would recommend thios hotel to anyone who is going to barcelona and hope to back shortly.

Reviews.Title: “My back still hurts from the hard beds.”
Reviews.Author: Kaytee56
Reviews.Content: The last four days of my holiday were ruined with a sore stiff back which came from sleeping on the VERY HARD narrow beds. I told the front desk and they "solved" the problem by adding a blanket to the mattress which didn't help much. The last few days of my holiday were painful and not very enjoyable. In addition, they charge to use the in-room safe which we didn't see anywhere else we stayed. The hotel was in a pretty good location and the rooms were clean.

Reviews.Title: “ok hotel, good location”
Reviews.Author: nycjones
Reviews.Content: after missing our flight, we just needed a place to crash. we had stayed in the other grupotel during our stay and felt this would be just as high of quality. sadly it wasn't. the hotel's entry is lovely and open. it's clearly being converted from 2 hotels to one. we had to take a crazy route up (elevator to the 2nd floor, down a corridor to an ancient elevator then up to the 5th floor) which had bits of debris in the hallway. rooms are large. bathrooms are good size but you must navigate around the door for the tight squeeze to the toilet. the bed was two single beds made up as two singles but pushed together as a double. while we don't mind the european style of two singles as a double, they're usually made up w/double bedding to at least give the impression it's a proper double bed. breakfast was 15 euros a person and completely inedible. we ended up just eating toast and tea for 30 euros total. staff was nice, location is great but clearly this is a hotel in transition. hopefully with time, it will be as nice as the other grupotel in barcelona which is very lovely! if you have a choice, head there!

Reviews.Title: “Grupotel Gravina.”
Reviews.Author: Holidaymaker32_08
Reviews.Content: My partner and I stayed here for six nights in February / early March. As other reviewers stated, we were also given a glass of cava on arrival. It was a nice treat. Our room was ready immediately,even though we arrived at 11am to the hotel. We were given a room on the fifth floor. The room itself was very small and very stuffy, but it was clean and kept clean throughout our stay. The hotel is in a perfect location for sightseeing and shopping, which was the aim of our break in Barcelona. The staff are very friendly and helpful. We only ate in the restaurant on two occassions, once for breakfast, which was nice. Good selection. We also had lunch on one ocassion in the bar, which was not that nice and extremely expensive for the quality we were given. My partner's birthday was during our stay here, and the hotel very kindly had a bottle of cava and some cake left in our room on the day itself. It was a very kind gesture on their behalf. All in all, our stay here was enjoyable and if I was to return to Barcelona, I would probably book this hotel again.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect for Us”
Reviews.Author: freecat
Reviews.Content: We went on a late honeymoon and spent 5 nights at the Grupotel Gravina. As other people have mentioned, once we'd checked in we were offered a lovely glass of champagne. My hubby was more in the mood for a cuppa so declined. We were seated in the bar area although the room was ready and I mentioned to the waitress about my hubby fancying a cup of tea so she kindly brought this and that was his welcome drink. We had a pleasant wait and relax for 10 minutes or so and then called to finish check-in and get our key. We had room 411 on the 4th floor. Seemed very satisfactory on first glance. I had had some trepidation about the double bed being small but was pleased to find it was massive! At least king and maybe queen-sized. Sofa in room, good wardrobe and massive sliding window. The bathroom was small but adequate. The bath was tiny! There was the usual telly with, for us, BBC world news and a couple of film channels. All spotlessly clean. As it happened, the location of the hotel turned out to be perfect for us, near but not on the Ramblas, and a Rock club just round the corner! Coming out of the hotel, doing a left and then another, the street - Carrer Tallers- which leads to the Ramblas has loads of alternative music and clothes shops and some bakeries. There is a tapas bar on the corner of the little street the Grupotel is on but we found 3 really good veggie restaurants not too far away from the hotel - the big Organic on Junta De Commerc, Juicy Jones on Carrer del Hospital (fab, vegan, and really cheap!) and Biocenter on Pintor Fortuny. Hotel is very close to the metro and the bus 'station' (all the buses sit round a massive square), where we were able to catch a cheap bus back to El prat airport (make sure you get the right bus for the right terminal!). So, location of hotel was brilliant we thought. We had breakfasts included in our deal and the breakfast spread did not disappoint! Everything possible to choose from in the way of food, a selection of fresh fruit juices, plus a rather impressive partitioned box containing a great selection of teas including green, red and mint! The only slight mishap in our stay was that the shower fitting was completely loose and one day the whole thing just fell off and the heavy shower head fell very painfully on my husband's toe. I let them know at reception and someone came to fix it sharpish the next day. The room was very well heated, could get too hot if you didn't have window open but wasn't a prob, we like window open at night so temp was perfect and I must say, medium firm mattress was perfect for me, pillows were perfect I wanted to take them, so I slept well throughout our stay. I'm a fussy so and so but would happily recommend this hotel. The deal we found on the net worked out cheap for what we got I thought.

Reviews.Title: “Nice hotel, good location.”
Reviews.Author: nicalver
Reviews.Content: I stayed at the grupotel gravina from 6/2/10 - 10/2/10. The hotel is in a good location and is easy to find from the bus stop from the hotel at catalonia plaza. The room was a good size, the bathroom was a good size too, and the shower was nice and powerfull. we stayed on the 4th floor in a room at the front of the hotel with a balcony. The main downside I would say at this hotel was that the rooms were boiling hot, we had to sleep with the doors open all night which was ok most of the time, but they do empty the bins at night for some reason! this only lasts a few minutes though so not too bad. After coming back from an evening out we wanted to stop in the bar for a few drinks but soon found out that the bar closes at 11:30pm, the bar staff though were very friendly and asked if we wanted any more drinks before they closed and they were quite happy for us to buy another round or 2 and sit in the bar area. the hotel is a 2 minute walk to las ramblas and close tot he metro which makes getting around very easy, we bought a T-10 ticket which gives 10 single trips, there were 4 of us and we used the same card for all of us. We were slightly concerned as most people we spoke to warned us about pickpockets, we had no problems, as long as you keep your bag/wallet in front of you and dont flash any expensive items i dont think you have much to worry about - its just something to be aware of. A couple of our group wanted to go to a barcelona game whilst there and were surprised when the hotel offered us tickets - with good seats. they were slightly more expensive than getting them at the ground but it saved the hassle of going to the stadium to pick them up, and risking wether there were any left. Breakfast wasn't included in our room but we were given a 50% off voucher for one day, which we took advantage of. Although there was nothing wrong with the food, it was ok, it was not worth the 15 euros at full price. Overall a good hotel, I would stay here again if we returned to Barcelona.

Reviews.Title: “Central but noisy”
Reviews.Author: tohtem
Reviews.Content: Very good location, not far from Plaça Catalunya and very close to metro Universitat. First room was really noisy with music and noise coming from ventilation shaft. We were moved to a very very very small room. Still, rooms are not sound proof. Beds have seen better days. Free wi-fi but slow. Staff very courteous. Breakfast buffet included in our rate. Good selection.

Reviews.Title: “Good all round hotel close to the centre of Barcelona”
Reviews.Author: belly5uk
Reviews.Content: The hotel was clean with all the staff very polite and helpful. The hotel is a ten minute amble to Les Ramblas and the centre of Barcelona and the shops. In brief a very good hotel close to everything you need in a weekend city break

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful Hotel, Wonderful Staff!”
Reviews.Author: EnglandLilly
Reviews.Content: I have just returned from a weekend break at the Gravina. It was lovely. It was my partner's 40th Birthday treat. I emailed the hotel beforehand and asked if they could make it a little bit special. We were given a mini suite with a lovely big balcony. We were also treated to a large bottle of chilled champagne and 2 slices of chocolate cake (these were in our room when we arrived). On our way out sightseeing (first day) we passed by reception and asked for some advice re public transport. I showed the young lady our itinerary and she went through each attraction showing me where they were on a large map of Barcelona which she gave us and explained the best way to get there. The staff in this hotel are 5 STAR. Nothing was too much trouble and nothing was a problem. They always had a smile and made us feel very well looked after. Customer service of this standard is a joy to witness and a pleasure to experience. Our suite was compact. It was not large but had absolutely everything we needed. It was very comfortable and very clean. We did not eat in the hotel. We did sit and have a drink at the bar however which is next to reception. It is modern, clean and classy. A nice place to sit for a quiet drink. The location of the hotel is superb. 5 mins walk from Las Rambla. We had a fabulous time in Barcelona. The weather was beatiful and the people we met were very very friendly and kind. Thank you Grupotel Gravina for a wonderful stay!!!

Reviews.Title: “Perfect location for a perfect holiday”
Reviews.Author: alibearScotland
Reviews.Content: I am so pleased I went with the online recommendetions for this hotel. I have just returned from a lovely week staying at this hotel. The staff were very courteous and the location was ideal. We had a mini suite with a balcony which was kept spotlessly clean by the staff. I would have no problems in making a recommendation to others.

Reviews.Title: “Better Late than Never”
Reviews.Author: jimkbobl
Reviews.Content: I title my review that because my props to a hotel I stayed at last year are long overdue. They were really great, and when I didn't wake up for a wake up call, a member of the staff actually came up to wake me. Breakfast was a lovely affair with some superb things on offer and dining there wasn't shabby either. The most important thing is always staff courtesy and they delivered with flying colors. Plus I got a great rate, and I couldn't ask for a better location, whether on foot or public transport. My room was small but cozy and really lovely with a nice tub too, so I must say, don't be worried at the prospect of single rooms being less than they're worth, it's quite the contrary.

Reviews.Title: “Good location nice and clean”
Reviews.Author: CharmNZ
Reviews.Content: This hotel was great. It had 2 computers at reception with internet access which was very handy. The rooms were a good size clean and comfortable. I was sick when we arrived so spent 1 whole day in bed and found that it had to be a great hotel to be sick in as it was so comfortable. The location was excellent very close to town. Great food for breakfast very good selection.

Reviews.Title: “Good Location, average hotel”
Reviews.Author: The_Sherlocks
Reviews.Content: The Gravina is very well situated down a side street, being about 2 mins walk from Las Ramblas and 5 mins from Placa del Catalunya (main square, where the buses and tourist buses stop, as well as having a main Metro station). Though the street is quiet, the hotel is not. Either the walls are thin, or sound carries through the aircon ducts. Either way, you can hear everything that goes on in adjacent rooms. Fortunately, we were so tired from all the walking we didn't get our sleep interrupted too much, except when guests arrived back from the clubs and were unable to talk quietly. The other big negative is the rock hard beds, which we've found before in Spanish Hotels. The hotel has been modernised and, though small, was pretty clean. The reception staff were excellent, well turned out, polite and helpful. We only ate in the restaurant for breakfast, which was continental buffet style, and was OK, with a wide range of hot and cold food & drink. Barcelona is a great city to visit - very easy to get about on public transport or the hop-on, hop-off tourist buses, loads to see and do (we didn't fit everything in over 5 days). There are some very good restaurants - we would recommend Las Quinze Nits in Placa del Reine off las Ramblas, TapaTapa in Port Vell, and the Hard Rock Cafe (Placa del Catalunya). Must visit sights are the obvious ones of Gaudi's (do all if you can, they are each worthy in their own right), and the Castell Montjuic (amazing views).

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful stay, wonderful hosts”
Reviews.Author: jlmVirginia
Reviews.Content: Very accommodating staff who spoke fluent English. Room spotlessly clean; had a pretty little patio outside the room which was nice and cool in the evening. Computer in the lobby was always available for use. Metro just a few minutes' walk away. Quiet area near the University. We highly recommend this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Great location”
Reviews.Author: Themelbournefalcon
Reviews.Content: This hotel was a good base for our five night stay in Barc. It has a fantastic location, off the main streets but still very close to the middle of the tourist centre. The room was decent and clean (nothing special) and we were upgraded from the small double to the large double (and so had quite a big room). Kettle, fridge and safe were all available which was a bonus. Staff very helpful and provided a map on arrival. Minor negative comments: it could be quite noisy at night (mostly street noise) but nothing too bad. We noticed a homeless person or two sometimes wandered in off the street to use the bathrooms downstairs in the breakfast area but security generally seemed to be pretty good. We felt that this hotel was over-priced for what it was but you are clearly paying for the location (most hotels in this area are a lot more expensive). We would recommend this hotel and stay in it again, although I would probably have a look around first for better deals at other hotels in the area.

Reviews.Title: “Enchanting Visit”
Reviews.Author: Dashvalley
Reviews.Content: Have just got back from our very first visit to Barcelona and I can honestly say the Gravina Hotel was excellent in that our room was upgraded to superior accommocation, perhaps due to being full and also it was leading up to our anniversary. When booking the hotel online a few weeks earlier I said we were going to celebrate our anniversary and perhaps that is why we had a much better room. Everything was clean, the staff were excellent and very friendly - nothing was too much trouble. After being out for a full day our room was always clean and well stock with towels. One review did say the towels had been used quite a lot and had a lot of miles on them, I have to agree with them on this point but it didn't spoil my trip. Location was excellent for cathing the Metro, the Aerobus, Playa de Catalunya and Las Ramblas and even the new Ramble de la Mer, the new broadwalk near the Christher Columbus Column. For my first visit, it was wonderful and I am going to return maybe next year for our wedding anniversary again.

Reviews.Title: “Location and nice staff...that's about it.”
Reviews.Author: travellemonde
Reviews.Content: Stayed for three nights and to be candid it wasn't the greatest experience. This is one of those hotels that attracts you with location, breakfast, and internet. The location and the staff were great, but the construction of the hotel was beyond poor in my opinion. I could hear everything happening throughout the hotel - very clearly. From bathrooms flushing and showers running, to footsteps accross the hall and floors, and even to what was happening in the building next door. I stayed on the left side of the hotel (as you walk in the front door), and there must have been a bowling alley or a prison next door because all I heard all night (and day) was banging and scratching on the walls, it was inexplicably annoying. I wanted to leave, but was having a document sent here and couldn’t. This alone was enough for me to never come back to this hotel again. I will add that the rooms were tiny but reasonable, the bathroom was almost unacceptably dirty on arrival, the floor of my room was a very poor quality fake wood laminate that was coming unglued, and the linens, while clean, had a lot of miles on them. If this hotel was not located in such a desirable location it would be two stars. Positives were the breakfast was decent , the water pressure and temperature were fantastic, good internet connecton, and the air conditioning was cold.

Reviews.Title: “This a great Hotel, you most stay at the Gravina”
Reviews.Author: RubenMexico
Reviews.Content: This is a excellent hotel, perfect located, walking distance form the plaza the Catalonia and the Ramblas (3 minutes) and in a small street that is very quite. the rooms are great, breakfast had a large selection, service and cleanliness top level this could easy be a 4 star hotel. I will come back here and recommend this hotel as the best choice for Barcelona. Ruben form Mexico

Reviews.Title: “Simply wonderful”
Reviews.Author: SamCookie
Reviews.Content: I was there with my kids before a cruise for two days. The staff is the best I have ever seen, Kris went out of his way to change our room upon arrival as I had mistakenly asked for " crib" and my son is 16, he made us feel like it was no problem at all and changed it by running to housekeeping himself. Before going to take care of this he got us a welcome drink. The room was quite comfortable and location very good. We had a family member die in the states when we there and Kris and Marta were both very kind. I would stay at this hotel again, I would go back to Barcelona just to stay there. Breakfast was also great. Quite a welcome change to the travel industry, there wasn't anything they wouldn't do for us.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic!.. perfect!”
Reviews.Author: blessing1Caribbean
Reviews.Content: Perferct..Fantastic.. just what you expect when you go abroad to a country like Spain.. Barcelona. Hotel staff were friendly and professional. We got complimentary Cava on arrival.. And the rooms were lovely.. Loved the bathroom!.. Breakfast was a wide variety.. And nice location, right in the heart of the shopping and tours.. Hope this helps.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel, fantastic location for exploring Barcelona”
Reviews.Author: HaynesNottingham_UK
Reviews.Content: We spent 4 nights at this hotel at the end of June / early July. We got a welcome glass of Cava on arrival which was a nice touch. The room was fine, spacious enough for us with a nice sofa/dressing area. The hotel staff were friendly and helpful with all queries. The hotels location is excellent for exporing the city, in the middle of everything yet on a quiet side street. I agree that the buffet breakfast is not worth the price but we used the 50% off vouchers we were given on arrival to try it one morning. Would recommend this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Charming Welcome at the Gravina”
Reviews.Author: BarneyDuell
Reviews.Content: On arrival at reception, we were offered a glass of Cava whilst checking-in, a lovely touch. The lady who dealt with us could not have been any more helpful. The room was quite small, but perfectly clean and adequate for our purposes. Great value for the price we had paid. The hotel is very close to the bustling Ramblas, but is tucked away in a side street, so is virtually unaffected by noise. Universitat Metro station close by, which was also very helpful. After we'd been out for a stroll we were delighted that a bottle of Cava had been put in our room with the compliments of the hotel along with birthday message for my partner. Again, this must have been down to the lady on reception, as she had taken details from our passports. Would not hesitate in re-booking this hotel. Excellent! Sorry about the blurred photograph (must be down to all that Cava!) but you get the idea....

Reviews.Title: “Great front desk staff”
Reviews.Author: Travelbug0505
Reviews.Content: Conveniently near Las Ramblas, rooms comfortable but small. Some rooms difficult to get to, especially if any disability. Large bathrooms. Front desk staff was great with referrals to restaurants, and help with the language, Spanish or English. Would definitely stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “well worth the price!!!”
Reviews.Author: GirlyTour
Reviews.Content: Good location to La Rambla - two minute walk . Staff are friendly and helpful. Rooms are clean and tidy except for my corner! May be considered small for some but satisfactory for somewhere to get your head down after taking in all of the many sights on offer and frequenting the many bars around. Half price breakfast buffet token for the first morning of your stay is a good offer to take up too. And if you're still not convinced, the shop next door sells Whiskey! Would recommend the open top tour bus for the two days - just 27 Euros.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel & location”
Reviews.Author: mollyandfamily
Reviews.Content: We stayed there for 4 nights over Easter and really liked the hotel. Two adults and three children in two rooms next door to each other. The rooms were good sized with sleeping area and an area by the window with a couch and table/chairs (one room used this area for fold-out bed for 3rd person). Plenty of room to unpack clothes and hang or store. Nice bathroom. Location was perfect. I agree not to do the hotel breakfast. Starbucks is just around the corner, as well as plenty of little cafes in the nearby Universitat plaza and a couple blocks from Catalunya plaza. Walk to almost all the sites if you like to walk. Great shopping around. Staff was not very friendly, but not rude either. Internet in rooms, also business center in lobby, although a pick-pocket tried to distract my husband while he was using the BC. Staff shooed the guy away after my husband said "leave me alone!" There is a guard at the door, but he must have stepped away? But that is Barcelona - filled with pickpockets, as I am sure you have read.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent hotel -would highly recommend it.”
Reviews.Author: visit09
Reviews.Content: Close to La Rambla and Placa Catalunia with good transport links. Excellent service from multi lingual staff. who are friendly yet professional. Rooms very comfortable and made up daily to a very high standard. Excellent choice of hot and cold buffet for breakfast.Small bar serving food throughout the day.2 computers available in the foyer area for the use of guests free of charge. Conference facilities available.Our room overlooked main street and yet was very quiet.

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel, Great Location”
Reviews.Author: ABCHampshire
Reviews.Content: The Grupotel Gravina is in a very central location in Barcelona. The airport bus terminates at Plaza Catalunya and the hotel is about 5 minutes walk from there. The hotel is very close to Las Ramblas, restaurants, cafes and transportation. The hotel has a pleasant modern lobby and the staff were polite, friendly and helpful. Our room was 111 on the 1st floor. Our 'family' room had a double bed and sofa bed which had been made up into a bed. The bathroom had a full bath and shower over. The room was clean and tidy. The hotel has free wireless internet which is great, international TV channels and a trouser press in the room. The breakfast was 15 Euros per person, which seemed a bit pricey, but we were offered 50% discount vouchers for the 1st day which we used. It was the usual buffet style affair with cooked eggs, bacon, cereals, toast, croissants etc - oh and pizza if you fancy it! On the 2nd day we had breakfast in a nearby cafe, there are plenty around if you prefer not to pay the 15 Euros. The only negatives about the hotel was that it seemed rather noisy at night - with people banging & knocking on doors and generally making in noise (what is it with some people!?) Of course this isn't the hotel's fault. The plumbing also seemed to be quite noisy too, after having a shower and when others did the same - not a major problem though, and didn't really impact on our stay. I would thoroughly recommend this hotel for anyone coming to Barcelona who wants to be in a central location, at an inexpensive but decent hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect location - good value for you money”
Reviews.Author: dedefournier
Reviews.Content: Like all our other hotels in Spain, we found this one on Trip Advisor. (See my other reviews for Cordoba, Sevilla, Granada and Roquetas de Mar). While searching for hotels, our main criteria was "Good value for our money". This hotel and all our other places we found were offering exactly what we needed. After traveling in 9 other cities in Spain, we wanted to drop our rental car to our last destination, Barcelona. Staying at Grupotel Gravina, we didn't need a car. We were close to the heart of the city, Plaza Catalunya and Las Remblas. We bought the Barcelona card before the trip, but didn't need to. In fact we could have bought it at the Tourist office in Plaza Catalunya, just walking distance from the hotel. Travelling in Barcelona is really easy with the metro and the bus. There are buses every 8 to 10 minutes weekdays. We travelled the city for 3 full days with our 10 year old son, going everywhere, without problem. When leaving for the airport we even took the train to the airport, included in Barcelona Card. The hotel was not luxurious, the room not that big, but it was clean, quiet, the staff was nice and there were 2 computers with free Internet access. They were fast too and supply a printer to print reservations. The PC was fast too. I was able to backup my 2000 photos on my usb key, much rapidly than at any Internet coffe all around the country. When arriving at the hotel there was a welcome sparkling wine. Plus we were given coupons for half price breakfast for the next morning. The breakfast was ok but not the best we had, compared to other hotels, and it was in a room without windows. So we decided the other days to go to McDonalds. North american people like us are used to have more than just coffee and pastry. At least there were pancakes at McDo and we paid less than we would have, if paying full price breakfast at the hotel.

Reviews.Title: “The bed was hard”
Reviews.Author: HexhamTraveller
Reviews.Content: We spent 3 nights at this Hotel, it was very well situated for easy access to the Ramblas and the Tourist Buses. The staff were very accomodating room 401 was big enough for us but the bed was extremely hard and we suffered lack of sleep. However it did not spoil a brilliant few days.

Reviews.Title: “poor size rooms”
Reviews.Author: dingbat
Reviews.Content: Just home from two night stay at this hotel when we arrived the room wasnt ready so we were given a glass of complimentry of champange 45 mins later i asked again if room was ready told it would b a further wait. When room was finally ready we were given a double room when i booked a twin and were told that it was only a request and not a guarentee so if u book a twin make sure to double check what ur getting because the size of thse rooms are a joke the smallest doble room i,ve ever come across.Air conditioning was crap and the wardrobe fell off its runners on more than 1 occasion. location was tidy close to ramblas but i wont go back to thid hotel

Reviews.Title: “Totally Overpriced”
Reviews.Author: cunninr2
Reviews.Content: My wife booked this hotel for 3 nights because it has a central location. However it seems to be the way with this hotel and many in Barcelona, that they will hike prices to an outlandish degree if there is a business conference in town. So first let me say, this review is based on the price paid (220 euro per night!). On arrival, the staff were friendly and welcomed us with a glass of champagne, which was a nice touch. The general walkways were tidy, but a little shabby. To get to our room we had to take 2 very small lifts. My wife took the stairs sometimes to avoid them. Our room was very small and we had to pack our suitcase away to move around freely. Generally, the room was clean, although the bedding was basic. There were no dressing gowns and only 1 additional blanket. The bath was tiny. It could not fit even 1 small adult. The room TV was basic with poor signal reception and although the hotel was advertised with Wi-Fi available, it was impossible to use anywhere but the lobby. it is a shame the management of this hotel are driven to exploit the Barcelona conference calendar. Had they stuck to an appropriate fee for their service category (2/3 star), this review might well be more forgiving. In summary, I would avoid this hotel. I hope their are more hotels in Barcelona that are less exploitative.

Reviews.Title: “Good Location”
Reviews.Author: Pauline_E_H
Reviews.Content: Great location, near to Ramblas and Plaza Catalunya. Staff very pleasant and most helpful, plus spoke excellent English. Easy to get to via Aerobus from Airport, although the driver took advantage of the fact that we spoke no Spanish, and wrong changed us by 2Euros. We booked via our local airline, and the room was large and had a balcony, overlooking a typical narrow Spanish street which was surprisingly quiet, given its proximity to a main thoroughfare. Breakfast was included in the price, but we ate our evening meal in the restaurant on the corner of the street - nice food and staff who understood us! Altogether a brilliant break.

Reviews.Title: “Great Location and Staff very helpful”
Reviews.Author: ShaunCork
Reviews.Content: We stayed here for 3 nights with my family for a Barcelona game. the 16th - 19th Jan.We booked 2 twins and a single room. The rooms were small but clean and the staff were very helpful and friendly . I booked through the Hotel website and my e mails were answered very promptly.The location is great and you are literally minutes from the metro, bus stops and Plaza Catalunya . Take the airport bus for 4 euro single. Hotel is a 100 m away. The breakfast was ok but nothing special.

Reviews.Title: “Great location in the heart of Barcelona”
Reviews.Author: af01
Reviews.Content: I stayed at Grupotel Gravina (now H10 Gravina i think) four nights in december 2008. We had booked a standard room through hotels.com, but I think we god a petit room – it seems though (from the floor plan) that there are many rooms in this size. THE ROOM The room was very small, but sufficient for us. I recon it was about 4 by 3 meters, but there were enough space for our two suitcases. There was a small double bed, which was a bit hard but I think this is standard in Spain after haven stayed on several hotels and expirenced the same. The room had a minibar, a safe and a small flat screen TV with cable-tv (two English movie channels and CNN in English, which is quite good in Spain – normally there aren’t any English channels to my expirence). Also there were a music speaker in the roof, quite nice to be able to listen to music without the TV on. The bathroom had a good size and was functional. LOCATION The location is great! It is located right in the center of Barcelona, if you as we do like to take a stroll thorugh the city you will find anything within walking distance. The rambla is just three minutes away with life 24h/day. If you anyway want to take the metro, it is 1 minute from Universitat station, and 3-5 minutes from Catalunya station with many connections). SERVICES The hotel offered a complimentary glass of Cava on check in, which was nice. Check-in and check-out was quick and without problems, and the staff was helpful in explaining about the city. We didn’t have breakfast as this was 17 EUR – in the cafés around you will get breakfast for 2-5 EUR. The free WI-FI is kind of a laugh. There is a network on every floor, and you are supposed to use the network on your floor. Often there was no internet connection on the network on our floor, and the only way forward was trial-and-error trying each floors WI-FI until we found a working connection. This is not very professional – I guess it is because there is no security activated on the networks so all kind of people in the area must be using the network. ALL-IN-ALL All-in-all we found the hotel to offer great value for money. We paied 75 EUR/night which was a very fair price compared to other hotels with a similar location. The hotel is not top class though, and the rooms are quite small. For our liking, taking the price vs. location into consideration, the hotel offered great value for money.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect location!”
Reviews.Author: DramaQueenx7
Reviews.Content: Booked this holiday for a late christmas present for my boyfriend,a 3 night break and had a fantastic time! The hotel has a FANTASTIC location, shops,restaurants and the ramblas is only a few minutes walk away where there are lots of bars,restaurants,takeaways,shops etc, and if you continue to the bottom of the ramblas there is a harbour and if you continue even further i believe there is a shopping centre. The hotel is very smart and modern, the room was small but had a flat screen tv and was very modern and clean.
