Thats all we needed for 3 nights, you are set down a side street which meant you didnt have all of the noise, i would recomend staying just off the ramblas so you avoid any noise.We had a fantasic time and will stay there again if we decide to visit barcelona again which i wiil! Staff were very helpful and friendly too! A great english bar is situated towards the top of ramblas which has a great atmosphere, exspecially when the footy is on, great staff too who make a real effort.

Reviews.Title: “Great location - but some rooms tiny!”
Reviews.Author: Jeeter
Reviews.Content: I stayed at the Grupotel Gravina with my wife on our honeymoon in June of 2008. The location is absolutely amazing - very close to Las Ramblas and every walking distance from the Port. The room we had, unfortunately, was extremely small. Given the many positive reviews on TripAdvisor.com, we decided to book this hotel and thought that the "tiny room" reviews were either written by big people or exaggerating. In retrospect the hotel itself was very nice, but our room was not more than 100 square feet (including the bathroom). My wife and I are both small, but one person had to be either on the bed or in the bathroom for the other to move about the room. I am sure the rest of the rooms in the hotel are bigger (I checked), but this was the only room in the hotel we could afford. If you do end up staying at the Grupotel Gravina, make sure you don't get the teeny tiny room (everyone knows which rooms they are)!

Reviews.Title: “Great location”
Reviews.Author: codraik
Reviews.Content: Great location, 5 mins from Las Ramblas, Placa Catalunya, MACAB, and the metro station. Room was spacious and relatively quiet given its location in the city centre. Walls are quite thin but you should be fine. Didn't eat at the hotel but there are lots of decent places in the vicinity. Although comfortable with courteous staff, its not a hotel you would lounge around in, but there is so much to see in Barcalona that this wont be a problem.

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel”
Reviews.Author: JanjanBradford
Reviews.Content: Just come back from a 4 day stay at this hotel. Booked 1 twin and 1 triple room after reading reviews of many hotels on trip advisor. Twin room was larger than expected with balcony, triple room had put- up bed in annex area. Location was excellent, near enough to the Rambles, but just out of the way of the noise and crowds. A tip if you are walking to the Rambles, turn left and left again out of the hotel, and walk along the back street - full of all kinds of interesting shops and not quite as busy as the main street, and leads right onto the Rambles. Definately take the tourist bus to see the sights, we got on the first bus at 9.30 and it was great - much less busy than at midday! Dont be afraid to hop on and off, its so easy. All 5 of us managed to come home without being robbed - we had been put off by the horror stories we had read - dont be, its just like any other large city, just be sensible. Back to the hotel - we all said we would definately book there again, staff are friendly, breakfast good but wouldnt say it was worth £17, if you like a good cuppa, take your own teabags, the ones supplied are very weak! All in all had a great time in Barcelona and Hotel Gravina, would love to go back!

Reviews.Title: “Poor quality hotel”
Reviews.Author: pinter11
Reviews.Content: Positive: location was good. Staff were ok, hotel was clean Negatives: We found this to be a very poor hotel. We booked a double room which was a shoe box size, we actually had to put our 2 suitcases in the bathroom to move around the room. The bed was a fold up camp bed with terrible sheets. The view from the windows was of wall(see photo) We were staying on the 4th floor and had to get 2 different lifts and 1 set of stairs to get to it plus the lift only held 2 suitcases and 1 person. The hotel was very noise and night and at best reminded me of a hostel.

Reviews.Title: “Everything we expected and more!”
Reviews.Author: VJ1212
Reviews.Content: Gravina hotel was excellent. The location was perfect. All the staff were friendly and all spoke very good English. It was my boyfiends birthday, so before we arrived I emailed them and asked for a champagne breakfast brought up to our room, which was lovely and prompt. The staff helped us find restaurants and places on the map. They always called or booked trips for us and were honest about tourist attractions. The rooms themselves were lovely, clean and the air conditioning was a god send! Getting to our room was a bit of a nightmare as you have to take two separate lifts, but didn't mind as we had a top floor room with a huge balcony. I think it was excellent for the money and I would definitely recommend it and go there again in the future.

Reviews.Title: “Gravina Didn't Disappoint”
Reviews.Author: Blurt
Reviews.Content: We booked the Gravina based on the reviews on Trip Advisor, so were prepared for a smallish room. We had booked a triple because we had our son with us, so there was adequate space...not huge, but then you don't come to Barcelona to stay in your room! Cava on arrival was lovely, air conditioning was adequate and mini fridge ideal for keeping drinks. Everything was clean and staff helpful. Our rate didn't include breakfast, but we did get a discount voucher for one day which we used on our last morning, otherwise euro 17 seemed a bit steep and as others here have said, there are plenty of cafes around to have breakfast. The location was fantastic and simply because of this, we would stay here again. The only noise issues we had were banging doors, but that certainly didn´t annoy us. We paid the money to use the room safe and kept an eye on things when we were out and about and the only time we felt really uncomfortable was in Barcelona Sants Railway Station.This was our first visit to Barcelona and indeed Spain and the Gravina was our starting point..other hotels visited on this trip were Hotel Rural Uson Hecho Valley Aragon; Can Cuadros Palouet Catalunya; Sa Rascassa Aiguafreda Costa Brava & Bliss Hotel Begur Costa Brava..I'm writing reviews for these hotels as well. TIP: If using the wonderful turistic bus service in mid July, don't try and get on at Placa de Catalunya...the wait is awful..catch a metro or walk to your first intended site and pick it up there. Also make sure you get your book of discount vouchers on your first ride and simply enjoy this great city.

Reviews.Title: “Liked it until we saw the enormous cockroach”
Reviews.Author: Copenhagen_girl
Reviews.Content: First impression of the hotel was positive. We liked the room, size was ok and the basics were there (TV, mini bar, desk), there was a small couch and a table. Bathroom was very nice, shower was excellent. Bed was comfortable with clean sheets and and room seemed clean. The air conditioning worked ok, didn't cool that much, was more about blowing air into the room. We were lucky, the weather wasn't too hot. Location was perfect, close to everything, Placa Catalunya and, Las Ramblas. It was great to be able to walk around the city and stop by the hotel to change shoes, drop off shopping bags etc. We did find an enormous cockroach in the bathroom one morning, which really put me off. We told the receptionist and he didn't believe us (!). Otherwise staff was very friendly and helpful. All in all, a good experience, but the cockroach did affect our overall impression of the hotel. Stayed on the 5th floor and didn't have to take two elevators (as mentioned by other reviewer).

Reviews.Title: “Please Avoid”
Reviews.Author: jimboy143
Reviews.Content: I stayed for a week in this hotel. Firstly, the location is superb. Right next to the LAs Ramblas and metro etc. However beware if you want to have a good night sleep. When I entered the hotel, the offered us champagne and I was impressed. We were given a hotel room where we had to first take an elevator to the 2nd floor and then go up and around to another elevator and then take to 5th floor. We said ok no problem, i have seen weirder things in Europe. The Room was better than the average rooms, it was good for the size. Bed looked good and the bathroom was good. However, the problem I had was the A/C did not work. It was nearly 90 degrees and the a/c wouldn't work at all. It would just blow air and not cool air as it was running in their lobby. They sent a repairman, he didnt speak english but was very nice and tried his best to fix it. We gave up and had to open windows at nights to sleep. The bedsheets seemed to be full of bed bugs or maybe it was too hot to sleep? I was scratching myself all over and so was my wife..we were so annoyed. 1st night in Barcelona was hell for us because of the room. We woke up groggy and said ok lets just enjoy....maybe it will get better. However they did not change the bedsheets and we complained again and it was then changed. But for some reason the problem still was there. I can go on and on. I just landed and got home and on the plane ride home, my wife kept on reminding me that make sure you write this revieew or you will forget. If you like good location and dont care for good location. This place is it..go for it. If you do want to book this hotel, beware of the rooms where you have to take 2 elevators..maybe those are the bad ones?

Reviews.Title: “Super Location”
Reviews.Author: Thombtc
Reviews.Content: My husband and I just returned from a Mediterranean cruise on the Emerald Princess. Barcelona was our last port where we disembarked. We wanted to experience Barcelona before going home and wanted to be near Las Rambla street where all of the action is in Barcelona.( Don't miss walking the whole length of the street from Placa Catalunya to the Port). This Hotel Gravina was very close and not too expensive compared to many other hotels. You definitely need 2 days to do everything and we only stayed 1 night, which wasn't enough. The hotel was nothing to rave about, but was very clean and great for taking the airport bus the next morning. It is about a 10 minute walk with luggage to Placa Catalunya. The blue Aerobus can be caught on the far side of the park from the hotel as you walk to Placa Catalunya. The cost was 4 euros pp for the bus and it took about 20 minutes to get to the airport. There were many people using the bus at 6:30 am. It runs about every 15 to 20 minutes and drops you right at the terminal you need. If you want a beautiful hotel, this isn't for you, but if you want clean and less expensive, you won't be disappointed. By the way, be sure if you take a taxi from the cruise that you get in line early for a taxi. We waited for 1 hour in a long, hot line, and then the taxi driver didn't know where Hotel Gravina was until I showed him the address on the confirmation statement from the internet.

Reviews.Title: “A Great Little Find”
Reviews.Author: pippar
Reviews.Content: We stayed for a week in this lovely hotel, and we would definitely recommend it to others. When booking we requested a twin room with a balcony, and this turned out to be a good move, as we looked in to some other rooms that were not as big as ours. Our room was large with a lovely (little) balcony looking out onto the quiet little street that Gravina is situated on. Even with the door to the balcony open we slept through the night, noise was not an issue. The air-con was so good that we were able to sleep with blankets covering us, even though it never went below 22degrees all week!! The room itself had everything that we needed for a week long stay (although we did notice no tea and coffee making facilites, we are not hot drinks people!) with comfy beds, a big spacious bathroom and a flat screen tv. The room was cleaned every day. Also, the hotel staff were very friendly, greeting us with champagne on arrival and always giving us helpful advice when we asked. The maid was also lovely, and always said hello when we went by! A small piece of advice for anyone that ends up in room 106- the toilet flush will only work when the bathroom light above the mirror is on! We did not have breakfast in the hotel, because we were on quite a strict budget so paid for room-only, but we did have a drink in the bar one night, beware it is rather over-priced!! However we bought breakfast things and drinks from the supermarket two doors down, which is owned by a really nice guy who we made friends with! Aside from that, the hotel is friendly, clean and comfortable, how a 3* should be. Of course if you are expecting luxuries or a honeymoon break then it is possibly not the place, but for a weeks sight seeing in a great location, the hotel greatly exceeded our expectations.

Reviews.Title: “A reasonable budget hotel in a good location”
Reviews.Author: Lord_Gin
Reviews.Content: I stayed at the Gravina for one night on a leisure trip. For the price paid, just under €100 including breakfast, I rank it 3 stars, although it is clearly a budget hotel. Staff was polite and helpful, and the breakfast was good. My room was relatively small, but I have stayed in smaller, and the bathroom was good. The air-conditioning at the Gravina is on the weak side, in all common areas and in the bedrooms as well, so keeps you just the right side of comfortable, but it certainly could have a bit more oomph. The hotel has no recreational facilities, so is only adequate for those that need the hotel just as a base for exploring Barcelona, in which case it offers reasonable value for money.

Reviews.Title: “The smallest bath I have ever seen”
Reviews.Author: Dr_Pete
Reviews.Content: My wife and I have just returned from a three night romantic break to Barcelona, where we stayed in the Grupotel Gravina. There's nothing fundamentally wrong with this hotel, but it did fall short in a number of important areas. Firstly, our room had the smallest bath I have ever seen. I'm not particularly tall, but even a child would have struggled to fit into the bath. So far as I could tell, this “feature” was common across a number of rooms. There was a shower, but I prefer baths and booked the hotel on the understanding that my room would have a bath. Secondly, the hotel told my wife and I that it was impossible to give us more than 1 key (between the two of us) for the room. This is possibly the most ridiculous claim I have ever heard from a hotel – but they were adamant that they could not give us a second key. Thirdly, the hotel is arranged across two adjoining buildings: floors 1 and 2 in the first building and floors 3 and upwards in the other building. The adjoining building faces out on to a very busy main road and not the “quiet side street” that the first building is on. The road is busy not just with traffic but through much of the night, also busy with revellers, due to its proximity to Las Ramblas. Expect noise. On the plus side, the staff were friendly and helpful. (They also appeared to be genuinely apologetic about the shortcomings mentioned above.) Furthermore, the bed was comfortable and the breakfasts were excellent. Another nice touch was the free internet access provided by the hotel – WiFi was available throughout, or a couple of PCs in the lobby were dedicated to internet access. Overall, it's not a bad hotel, but for the price I paid I expected better.

Reviews.Title: “Would not recommend this hotel”
Reviews.Author: MrsKGloucestershire
Reviews.Content: We have just returned from a City Break in Barcelona to celebrate our wedding anniversary. We had booked this hotel through Lastiminute.com three months ago. We booked a "romantic double" with extras at extra cost and requested a room with a nice view. We arrived expecting a really nice room with pampering extras. Be warned - this is not what you get. We got a very small double room with double bed and only just enough room to move around it. It had an extremely hard mattress, skirting board coming off wall, sealer - black and disintegrating around the bath, cracked handbasin. There were no extras until we complained repeatedly. The room looked out onto the wall of the adjoining property. A total disappointment and definitely not what we had booked and paid for. On complaining to staff we found them offhand, disinterested and unhelpful. We were not offered alternative accommodation. After two awful, uncomfortable nights, we decided to move to a lovely hotel around the corner. This was a 3* hotel, far, far superior to the Gravina. Wish we had gone there straight away.

Reviews.Title: “Watch out for thiefs”
Reviews.Author: Roz49
Reviews.Content: Hotel in great location just 5 mins from Las Ramblas, however my weekend away was ruined because I had my jewellery stolen from inside our locked room. Hotel staff said they could not do anything as I should have had it locked in the safety deposit box. So on my birthday I had to visit the police station and they were not very helpful or friendly. Dont let the chambermaids in to clean your rooms as you cant be sure its not them. They were the only ones to have access to our room! So be warned as well as being careful about pickpockets outside be very aware about pickpockets inside the hotel!

Reviews.Title: “Lovely hotel - great location and good value”
Reviews.Author: Gunner92
Reviews.Content: If I was going to run a hotel, I think this is close to how I'd do things. Late check out (12pm), wide selection for breakfast (sausage & eggs, or cereal, or toast and fruit, or pastries, etc), breakfast up until 10.30am, free internet in the lobby, very helpful staff, glass of Cava on arrival, lots of info booklets handed out, lovely clean rooms, etc.. The location is good for Las Ramblas - the staff in the bar over the road are good fun as well and this is always a good starting point for a night out. We had a good nights sleep on every one of the 5 nights we were there - no noise from inside or outside the hotel. Some english speaking channels on the telly - radio in the room is quite amusing - jazz versions of some pop classics !!!! Bath was on the small side - legs hanging out the end, but that really was the only bad point we could mention. Highly recommended !!

Reviews.Title: “A nice, affordable hotel in the perfect location”
Reviews.Author: emausten
Reviews.Content: Grupotel Gravina may not be the poshest hotel in Barcelona, but it provides a wonderful home base for seeing the city at a good price. Just 2 blocks away from the top of La Rambla and a ten minute walk from the Block of Discord, you can't stay in a more central location for seeing Barcelona's top sights. Our room was a nice size and had a balcony that overlooked a quiet street. Our only minor complaint was that we could hear the noise in the hallway when our neighbors came in and out of their room, and when the housekeeper vacuumed relatively early (9:30ish) in the morning. Otherwise, this hotel was definitely a great choice for those who are more concerned about saving a few Euros than staying in the most upscale hotel in the city.

Reviews.Title: “Nice hotel but dont buy tickets through them”
Reviews.Author: Neil47
Reviews.Content: Nice clean Hotel, friendly generally helpful staff, convenient location, only dissapointment, when I asked about buying tickets to see FC Barcelona, receptionist told me this could be done by them, ticket price was 80 Euros per ticket, this included delivery fee, when they arrived the face value of the ticket was 48Euros ! a delivery fee of 32Euros per ticket, a complete rip off.

Reviews.Title: “Loved the Hotel”
Reviews.Author: MrsJMidlands
Reviews.Content: Just returned from 3 nights at the Grupotel Gravina. Agree with the comments given by other reviewers. It is a lovely hotel, very central to the main tourist areas. We stayed B and B and the breakfast selection was very good indeed. Rooms not huge but perfectly adequate, cleaned daily. We stayed on the first floor so we did experience some usual hotel noise between about 10 and 12pm, such as toilets flushing, general water flowing and people moving furniture (why do people do that?). The staff were all very friendly and helpful.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect Location.”
Reviews.Author: MCBarry
Reviews.Content: Just stayed at the Gravina for three nights with my wife for our anniversary. Lovely reception with drinks and a bottle in our room with robes, slippers etc. Room was on top floor and very quiet. The hotel is a minute away from the metro and a short walk from the main Catalunya square and Ramblas. Barcelona has a great public transport system but watch out for pick pockets on the metro - my wife had her purse taken from her zipped up handbag by a very respectable looking old lady - just a little touch is the give away. It was a hassle phoning bank and going to police etc but it didn't spoil the holiday. Hotel staff very helpful on this.Take some decent shoes and be prepared for a lot of walking, it is a city which encourages exploration by foot, so much to see. We walked miles and would recommend the beach and front. Would recommend hotel for couples and people seeking a quiet, comfortable break.

Reviews.Title: “Nice Hotel, Friendly Staff, Nice food”
Reviews.Author: michael87
Reviews.Content: I went to this hotel earlier this month (20th-24th March). The staff were excellent very professional, friendly & helpful. We recieved a glass of bubbly on arrival, the reception area was very nice, the bar was small but cosy and they had a large tv on the wall, they would let you watch what you want if you were the only one there. The resteraunt was nice, we sample the 3 course meal for 20 euros (around £15), where I had soup, steak and ice cream, it was well worth the money. The room i was in was 408, i think it was one of the better rooms in the hotel as i had a balcony that overlooked the entrance rather than the backstreet where there was building work going on. The room was two single beds however they were a bit unconfortable. The layout of the room was good, there was a tv with satelite, mini bar & radio although I never used the mini bar or radio. Both the hotel & rooms were very clean and the maids came every day i was there. The two PC's in reception were good for checking emails and i believe there is wireless access in all rooms for those on business. The hotel is in a good location, about 5 mins walk from the top of Las Ramblas, there are lots of shops nearby which include Subway, McDonalds, Burger King, Costa, Topshop, Zara, C&A plus some spanish shops. I highly reccomend this hotel to people who want a good cheapish hotel for football matches, stag party's, businessmen & long weekend breaks

Reviews.Title: “nice hotel”
Reviews.Author: laurat-7
Reviews.Content: This was a nice hotel in a good area to explore. On arrival we were greated with a glass of bubbly or juice. We arrived there early and our room was ready which was great. Our room was on the road so it was very noisy at night and because the room was quite hot we had to sleep with the window open, again this was extremely noisy. The bathroom was okay except for the water from the shower going everywhere, but this was not a problem as I used one of the towels and reception bought me up some more towels quite quickly. The rooms were very clean and the bed was comfortable. Overall the hotel was pleasant. It was my birthday whilst we were there and when we arrived back from our day out we have a lovely bottle of bubbly in our room with a birthday card from the hotel. They must have known it was my birthday from my passport. The breakfast is plentiful with a small hot selection as well as cold selections. I would stay there again but would probably request a room which isn't on the road.

Reviews.Title: “good location but disappointing room”
Reviews.Author: fee3
Reviews.Content: We stayed 4 nights at this hotel. The location is very good being within 100 yds of the Placa de Catalunya at the top of the Ramblas. ( although anywhere fairly near the Ramblas would be fine). The staff were very friendly but the room, although it was a superior double, was very small and not very comfortable. Nowhere comfortable to sit and read your book except on the bed which was not attached to the headboard so kept slipping away from the wall. We were given a voucher on arrival for a 40% discount off breakfast on one day. However, even with the discount breakfast was over 10 euros each. If, like us you don't want a huge breakfast on holiday, there are plenty of cafes in the vaccinity where you can get a coffee and croissant for a fraction of the price. We were very impressed with Barcelona - port, beaches. wonderful architecture, shops etc. - a really beautiful city.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Location in the Catalan capital !”
Reviews.Author: Rick64
Reviews.Content: My girlfriend and I stayed at the Grupotel Gravina in the first week in March. The city was vibrant, which was also aided by the steady arrival of around 12,000 Celtic supporters for their Champions League game with the mighty Barca. All good spirited fun, well-behaved, great atmosphere! The hotel location is excellent, only five minutes walk from Place Catalunya and The Ramblas. You can catch the Aerobus from directly outside the main “El Prat Airport” terminal if you fly with Easyjet. A return bus fair into the city centre costs 14 Euro and if you get off at Place Universitat (the stop before Catalunya), then the hotel is only 100 metres walk. You walk along Carrer de Pelai and turn first right into Calle Gravina. We were greeted upon check-in with a lovely glass of Cava, and our check-in was very quick. We were allocated a room with a balcony on the 5th floor, which was of a fair size, and extremely clean. It had a nice flat-screen tv, minibar and coffee making facilities. The beds have sometimes been described as hard/firm. They were firm, however we found that they were strangely very comfy and had no trouble sleeping in them. We booked B & B, which was an excellent choice, as the breakfast facilities were spot-on. You have a huge selection to choose from, cereals, croissants, savouries, flans, fresh fruit, toast and hot food also, that included bacon, hash browns, scrambled eggs, mushrooms, tomato and sausages (a bit spicy). The Port Vell area is easily reached by a pleasant stroll down The Ramblas, and you can find many nice restaurants, shopping and The Aquarium. The best way to see the city and its attractions is via the Bus Turistic. This service was on strike when we visited but was replaced by Barcelona Tours who did a marvellous job. There is so much to see and visit in this city that it is worth doing your homework before you travel. For instance, the location of the cable car that runs from Avenue Mirimar (Montjuic) over Port Vell to Barcelonetta is not greatly advertised, but is worth finding as the view is spectacular. Visit Barcelona, enjoy this lovely city, and a stay at the Grupotel Gravina is the perfect base for your holiday… Recommended !

Reviews.Title: “Central location Clean and tidy - but small”
Reviews.Author: jamescim
Reviews.Content: I stayed for 1 night on business, the Hotel is in a great central location (near to the Ramblas) and is very welcoming with a clean and tidy reception and room. The receoptionist was very helpful with good maps and directions, and free Internet access with 2 PC's in reception. However my room (204) for a double was very small with a window which overlooked a 4 other rooms as it was a air duct. However they did have better rooms, but mine was a late deal via Expedia! I got the impression most of the rooms were sold via Expedia as the only nationally was English/American. Don't bother with Breakfast in the Hotel, live like a local and go to La Boqueria fruit/fish/meat market about 10 minutes away. The food is all fresh from the stalls and was highlight of the trip!

Reviews.Title: “Barcelona again??”
Reviews.Author: barcelonagain
Reviews.Content: We have just returned from five days in Barcelona and the Tripadvisor reviews are pretty much spot on for this hotel. It's in a good location and very clean. Many reviews mention the 'firm' beds - this is decieving as I think that we would have been more comfortable sleeping on the laminate flooring. There is also mention of street noise. The hotel is located on a 'side' street and our room and balcony faced the street albeit four floors up. The noise from the street was incredible - not just vehicles and building works but mainly shouting. The hotel has laminate flooring throughout and guests are pretty much allowed, and enjoy, the sport of small hours door slamming and furniture moving!!! Barcelona itself was a very busy, loud and 'full-on' city. Smoking was allowed everywhere and the majority take full advantage. There is a constant blue haze of smoke rising from the city. Take full heed of warnings concerning the theft of valuables etc. Locals and websights warn of the perils of the Metro and Las Ramblas...we suffered our theft of rucksack and contents whilst sat near to the beach area. Reporting the matter to the Police was an experience and we joined a significant line!!! I do not invisage returning.

Reviews.Title: “Clean room w/nice sitting area”
Reviews.Author: Albuq1
Reviews.Content: We just got back from Barcelona. This hotel is in a central location. The hotels close to Plaça de Catalunya (this is where the bus for the Turista starts and where the bus from the airport picks up/drops off). The hotel staff was extremely nice/helpful and spoke English. Our room was on the 1st floor 111 or something like that and it was super noisey. We had to buy earplugs to sleep; it sounded like people were moving furniture all hours of the night; I am not sure if there is a restaurant under our room?!?! The room was clean and had a nice sitting area seperate from the room. The beds are quite firm so if you do not like a firm mattress I would not recommend sleeping here, but I like my mattress firm. The location is excellent so any hotels in this area are a plus for location.

Reviews.Title: “Friendly staff,good facilities and a great location”
Reviews.Author: doonhamer
Reviews.Content: A very clean hotel only 3 minutes from La Rambla. Rooms are well presented. A good breakfast is available and we used the restaurant on the first night for a set price 3 course meal - good value. Staff are very friendly. I would certainly stay here again - it is very central for all main attractions. Only negative points were the shower was not too strong and if you wanted tea/coffee in your room it had to be purchased.

Reviews.Title: “Grupotel Gravina Barcalona”
Reviews.Author: RobmanUnitedkingdom
Reviews.Content: We have just returned from the Gravina in Barcelona, we stayed from Wed 20th Feb until the 24th [Sun] , we arrived late about 11.15 after a typical Ryanair flight [ say no more ] . The reception staff were very good and efficient, we were soon in our room on the 5th floor, the hotel is in two separate buildings but conneted easy to get around . Our room overlooked a main Street which was quite noisy with the balcony doors open, no more than you would expect in the heart of a major city. It was close to La Rambles which is what we wanted. The rooms were cleaned every day, with clean towels etc when ever needed. We never ate or had a drink in the Hotel but the menu seemed okay. Barcelona was fantastic with plenty to see and do, getting around was quite straight forward using the metro, but much more fun when walking. Must sees are the Sagrada Familla in the Example area, this is stunning, as is the Palau Nacional which has fountains that cascade towards the Font Magica, go in the evening , check the start time it was 7.00 for us, but it might be different in the summer, and you will be treated to the most spectacular water, light and music show possible.

Reviews.Title: “Watch the cancellation guidelines at this hotel”
Reviews.Author: TheGrimesReview
Reviews.Content: I had booked one night at this hotel for 21st Feb as was due to travel to Andorra on the Friday. However due to unforseen circumstances my airline cancelled the flight to Barcelona. I therefore had to find alternative flights and the only one I could get was to fly to Girona. It therefore made sense to travel to Andorra from Girona rather than Barcelona. I contacted Hotels.com to let them know the situation at least three weeks before I was due to stay at the hotel asking if they could cancel the hotel. They could cancel the hotel but there would be no refund of any monies. I find this shocking that a hotel has this policy. I can understand if you are cancelling within a week but to cancel up to three weeks before and not be offered any refund is staggering. I will never look to use this hotel again and I will be watching out for this in the future. Be warned !!!

Reviews.Title: “great little place couple liverpool”
Reviews.Author: gatti
Reviews.Content: Me and my wife just returned from barcelona excellent little hotel clean modernand staff very helpful. Great location right by plaza catalunya plenty of tapas bars close by and good shopping for the wife.

Reviews.Title: “Good Standard; Great location”
Reviews.Author: SonnyboyPontypridd
Reviews.Content: Like others we booked the hotel following the positive reviews on this site. It certainly lived up to expectations. We stayed in Graviina II which is linked to the main hotel. It does mean a little walk from reception but it really isn't far and I think this part of the hotel complex must have the larger rooms. Ours was an excellent size, something I hadn't expected given some of the reviews read. I agree with everyone who praised the reception given on arrival. The breakfast too was full of choice and the breakfast room light and airy. The hotel was easy enough to find and brilliantly located. Like others I would recommend taking the Aerobus from the airport. the closest stop is Placa Universitat but if you pass this stop the hotel is only a 5 min walk from the final stop on the journey (Placa Catalunya). Take the hop on hop off tourist bus to take in the main tourist sites of the city. You'll save time doing it this way. The time you do save should of course be used to walk "La Ramblas" but don't be afraid to dart left or right off it to explore the maze of streets that make up the Barri Gothic & Raval areas. These areas represent old Barcelona and have some great shops, restaurants and bars. Parts of the Raval do get a bit dodgy at night though!! You'll love Barcelona and for less than £40 a night B & B (if you shop around) you can do a lot worse than making the Hotel Gravina your base.

Reviews.Title: “Lovely Hotel, Fantastic Location”
Reviews.Author: nickymetcalfe
Reviews.Content: I booked this hotel for our stay (my partner and I) in Barcelona after reading other reviews on this site. It is an excellent hotel. It is very close to Las Ramblas (lots of shops, bars, restaurants etc) and about 2 minutes from the Metro. There is a shuttle Bus which leaves from outside all Airport Terminals, which takes you to the top of Las Ramblas, and the hotel is about a 5 minute walk from here (10 with a suitcase)! We arrived at about 12 noon, and although you cannot check in until 2, you are welcome to leave the suitcase behind reception. All the staff we spoke to spoke good English, even after I made my introductions in Spanish! There are 2 lifts to take you to the rooms. We were on the second floor, and our window overlooked the street. I was a little bit anxious that it would be noisy, but although audible, the daily bustle is not intrusive at all. The rooms are exceptionally clean, and there is a lovely bathroom with a nice powerful shower. I believe some people have said their rooms have been small, but ours was a nice size. The Breakfast is served from 7-10.30AM, and is lovely! Lots of choice, and all fresh. There is a little shop next door to the hotel where we bought water and munchies, which is also ideal. There is also 2 computers in the lobby with free internet access. Barcelona itself is very nice. We arrived on Saturday & flew home on Monday. We did not do everything the guide books suggests, but we had a mooch round the shops on Saturday, visited Sagrada Familia (well worth a visit), and the Spanish Arc di Triumpf, and the park which is near to this. All I would suggest is to perhaps stay an extra day, so you get to see a little more than we did. We had a lovely time, and this is a lovely hotel, with nice food and helpful staff. I would recommend it to anyone.

Reviews.Title: “not disappointed”
Reviews.Author: toffeemanHampshire
Reviews.Content: booked on the strength of Tripadvisor reviews and was not disappointed.Ideally located for La Rambla etc,rooms very clean if a bit small,with modern flat screen TV with multi channels.Breakfast inclusive is a MUST,as there is an extensive range of hot and cold food.The staff are very attentive,and once they discovered it was my birthday,they sent up a bottle of fizz to my room;a great gesture from what is remember only a 3 Star offer.Internet access in the lobby is FREE,which is a bonus for the teenagers during quiet times.

Reviews.Title: “Room not as advertised”
Reviews.Author: 7agatha55
Reviews.Content: We had a very poor experience at this hotel. We booked a 5 night stay--booking a double room via Hotels.com. The choice of rooms was: double, single or suite. The double room illustrated on the web-site looked OK, so we booked it & in order to secure the quoted price, paid up-front. We arrived from England at 9.30 pm & were given a room that was nothing like the room illustrated. It was 8ft 6 x 10ft 6!! We asked to change rooms, & were refused, being told that that was the room we had paid for. The web-site picture, we were told, was misleading!! Next morning we again requested a change. This time it was agreed, but only if we paid an extra 30Euros a night ---for a "superior" room. (No such room was listed in the hotel tariff.) The room we were given was identical to the picture on the website. After returning to the UK we wrote to complain to the hotel management, but have received no reply (3 1/2 weeks) I would definitely NOT recommend this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel for the money”
Reviews.Author: cabsandy
Reviews.Content: Used this hotel in a triple room with 2 friends for a 2 night stay, whilst in Barcelona for a football match. Upon arrival, was met with a smiling face and a glass of champagne-good start! They all speak good english as well. Nice bar and reception, "free", yes free, Internet in the bar and some nuts as well. Looked very clean as well. Rooms are a wee bit tired looking, but nothng major-what do you expect for 50 euros a night? Bathroom was clean, beds were good.Rooms are a good size-if your lucky, you get a balcony onto the street, but if not, its still ok. Location is excellent-5 mins walk from Las Ramblas and Placa da Catalunya square-Metro to all main parts of the city is on your doorstep. Also, there is a Subway and a Starbucks 2 mins away so sorted on that front. All in all, a very enjoyable stay and if you looking for a cheap, clean, friendly and well located hotel, then you'd be hard pressed to beat this one.

Reviews.Title: “Close to public transport”
Reviews.Author: Tiggsy
Reviews.Content: I've just returned from a 3-nights' stay at this really comfortable hotel. It's really close to one of the Metro stations and the airport bus stops - incoming - just 150 metres from the hotel. Like all the other reviews I want to add my thanks to the staff for their friendliness and total professional attitude at all times. We arrived early but the room was ready so we wer able to unpack and had another complete half day to explore the city. We were welcomed with a glass of Cava which was a charming little extra. The staff all speak perfect English and are always on hand to help in every way their guests need. Free wifi available 24/7 which is a real bonus. The rooms are fine with trouser press, tea and coffe making facilities, although you would have to take your own tea/coffee or buy from reception. Bathrooms are great with shower gel, cotton wool pads, shower cap, soap, hair dryer. The shower is a power shower with different settings and the water was always hot. The buffet breakfasts could never be beaten - a veritable feast. Do make this your preferred choice when visiting Barcelona......it's great. Just about 8 minutes' away from Placa Catalyuna too - in fact everything was in walking distance - if you feel like it!

Reviews.Title: “Great place to stay”
Reviews.Author: jan4jondyer
Reviews.Content: Just returned from 3 night stay at Gravina hotel, selected following recommendations on your site. Booked a triple room(3 adults) and whilst not huge was perfectly adequate for our needs.Twin beds and small alcove with sofa bed. I was impressed by the friendly reception and free glass of cava on arrival. Couldn't check in til 2pm, but they did hold our passports and suitcases whilst we went and did a little sightseeing. Immaculately clean hotel, centrally located just off Place de Catalunya and La Ramblas,so not too noisy. Excellent hot and cold buffet breakfast sets you up for the day. Only negative was no view, but how important is that really? Got my camera stolen so be careful with your bags - again hotel staff were fab and helped me fill the police report out on-line.

Reviews.Title: “Great Location”
Reviews.Author: Jandal99
Reviews.Content: This hotel was lovely, beautiful clean, modern, rooms and bathrooms and our room overlooked the street and had a balcony which was an added bonus (good to hang the washing out too!) Only complaints would be the beds, they were as hard as rocks and my side went numb during the night. The queen size bed was just two singles put together and they were made up seperately and on wheels so it was a bit difficult to cuddle up with your partner! The shower also wet the bathroom floor and toilet but as i wasn't cleaning it myself it didn't cause any problems. It was good having free internet access and worth waiting for on the odd occasion I had to. Staff were friendly and helpful, breakfast buffet had a great choice and there was plenty to go around. The restaurant evening meal was very nice and very reasonably priced. I would definately stay here again

Reviews.Title: “More than I expected! Wonderful experience!”
Reviews.Author: SleepingPixel
Reviews.Content: The Grupotel is centrally located and sits between Metro stops Universitat and Catalunya. It is an ideal location for a first time visitor to Barcelona. Plaça de Catalunya, the "it" department store of Spain "El Corte Inglés" and a shopaholic's paradise on Avinguda del Portal de l'Angel is but a short walk away. Also right next to the hotel on the right is a little grocery store where you can get snacks and water. They seem to remain open late. We stayed in room 324 (for 4 nights) which has a balcony overlooking Carrer de Pelai from which you could see Plaça de Catalunya. I didn't have any problem with the noise because I didn't hear any. The room by my European standards was huge! We had 2 closets, 2 twin beds, a 2 seater couch by which a table and chair shared room with, a writing desk and a flat screen tv which looked about 15". The bathroom was also quite spacious with enough room for 2 girls to walk in and out of while getting dressed/putting on makeup without getting into each other's way. It was clean and comfortable. The staff was courteous and helpful with everything we asked them from recommendations for dinner to directions. We requested 2 wake up calls during our stay and I was expecting a phone call but instead they knock on your door to get you up which for a deep sleeper such as myself is quite helpful. The internet connection is not so great but then again you're on vacation, you shouldn't be on the internet that much. It was good enough for light checking of email and looking up google maps. A con I have about the Grupotel is the small elevators. It was a little difficult to maneuver our luggage. Also getting luggage to our room was a bit of a pain because at one point we had to carry it up a few steps which made me wish I packed lighter. I would most definitely stay here again and highly recommend it to all of you out there!

Reviews.Title: “Enjoyed three wonderful nights at Gravina”
Reviews.Author: VAtraveler1
Reviews.Content: Barcelona was the second stop during our honeymoon. We weren't sure what to expect at the Grupotel Gravina, but they certainly exceeded our expectations! The staff was incredibly friendly and helpful. Upon check-in, we were served complimentary glasses of cava (Spanish sparkling wine). When we got to our room, we were surprised to find we had been upgraded (the only hotel out of five during our honeymoon that did upgrade us for our special occasion) to a fantastic suite in Gravina II (their new building). The room was large, had wood floors, modern furnishings, two large closets, and two nice balconies. We loved it! We did peek into the standard rooms. They were nice; very clean, though more basic than our suite. The Gravina also has a nice bar and restaurant, with very good food. There is also internet access in the office. Finally, the Gravina's location was very convenient to La Rambla, and near the airport bus stop. Our only complaint: the room had a slight moldy odor, but it was mild enough to be unnoticeable after being in the room a little while.

Reviews.Title: “Great location, friendly staff, quiet street”
Reviews.Author: hdichter
Reviews.Content: Things to recommend the Gravina: great location that allows easy walking access to many of Barcelona's fun and terrific neighborhoods; quiet street; friendly staff; typically European small, but also clean, modern rooms with great bathroom; easy access to public transit; internet access, including wireless for the hotel room. Our group consisted of my husband and myself, and our two kids and niece, ages 18 through 23. Everyone felt satisfied with the Gravina. We would recommend the hotel and would use it again- we especially liked being able to walk so many places from this hotel. We asked for a room with a balcony, which was also a plus at this hotel. While small, we used it and enjoyed it.

Reviews.Title: “Great Experience”
Reviews.Author: MilRom
Reviews.Content: Upon arrival we were greated with Champaign which was a nice touch after a tiring trans-con flight. Our standard room was spotless, but VERY small (about a 3 ft wide walkway at the foot and the side of the bed). The view about of our window was of a wall 5 ft in front. The bathroom, which was also imaculate, was quite large about 65% of the size of the room, if not more. However, the service was IMPECABLE and the breakfast was plentiful. After complaining about the size of our room and requesting to be switched, the staff (who was very knowledgable, helpful, and available at all hours of the day or night) checked daily to see if the switch would be possible. Also, to make up for the inconvenience of the small room, we received a pleasant surprise in our room: robes, slippers, chocolates, and a bottle of champaign on ice with a note "Compliments of the Hotel". Given that we hardly spent any time in our room, the size of the room did not put a damper on our experience. We loved the hotel and the outstanding service that we received. Also, all rooms are equiped with wireless internet.

Reviews.Title: “Football match was main attraction”
Reviews.Author: neilem
Reviews.Content: This was my first time going to Barcelona, and the main attraction was to watch the football match, so the hunt for a hotel began. Reading through alot of reviews on hotels, I luckily came across Gravina and took the chance. My personal opinions of Gravina are positive; the staff were extremely friendly and helpful, the food tasted great and modestly priced, the beer on draft was a constant regular for me (yea, I'm Irish). There is free internet access if you needed it, and a laundry service which obviously comes with a cost. You have the option of charging to the room or cash. You are greeted on entry to the reception through sliding automatic doors which they are multi-lingual, a security guard is patroling entrance during the evening/night time. Also there is no carrying luggage up flights of stairs (woohoo)... two lifts are in operation. I got a single room each, for myself and a friend, on my initial impression it was pretty small, but later thought I wouldn't have needed anything bigger. It was catered with a wardrobe with hangers inside, really good air conditioning, a room safe (which you need to buy a key for), a television, room bar, wooden flooring, desk and chair, marble bathroom with a shower and flowing hot water ready for use. If you need an iron, you can simply as reception. The location is very quiet, and is just a 4minute walk away from the Las Ramblas. Unfortunately I didn't use the Metro much, only on my way back from the match at the Nou Camp, but a taxi up there costs about 10 euro, it's about 7 euro to the beach using taxi (but I walked it in 25minutes when I knew where exactly it was). The metros and a train station is just outside the hotel and is easily spotted. I enjoyed my first experience of Barcelona and the stay in Gravina enhanced that. Would most likely welcome myself back again if I make a return to Barcelona.

Reviews.Title: “Great Location, Good value”
Reviews.Author: lazylisa
Reviews.Content: We've just returned from a 3 night stay at the Gravina. Like most people our room was small, it really needed to be abit bigger and have abit more cupboard space. It was ok for our short stay but you wouldn't of wanted to have such a small room for a week or more. The bathroom was huge though, so no complaints there. The reception, bar and restaurant were modern looking and very clean and tidy - full air con too. Champagne on arrival was a nice touch and my partner being tee total was offered orange juice. The breakfast was good - lots to choose from and always plenty to go round. The location is great, just off a main street leading off Placa de Catalunya/Las Ramblas. All in all I would recommend this to anyone.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Hotel”
Reviews.Author: Ange72
Reviews.Content: The hotel was lovely and clean and the staff were really nice and helpful. After looking at some of the reviews, I was a little unsure what we would be going to but I was pleasantly surprised. The room was fine, enough room to move around, the bathroom was spotless every day we were there. The air conditioning was on while we were there and no smells either! The food is excellent, I would recommend eating in the restaurant as the food is a lot cheaper than La Rambla bars and tasted better too! I would go back to this hotel as it is placed perfectly at the top of the town and is lovely and quiet too.

Reviews.Title: “Good times at Gravina”
Reviews.Author: suzeandmavis
Reviews.Content: We stayed at this hotel for 4 nights as our honeymoon. We were a little wary after reading a mix of reviews but are pleased to say that we had a great trip and would go back to this hotel. The communal areas eg reception, breakfast area and restaurant were very luxurious looking. Our room was not quite as special but at the same time there was nothing to specificially complain about - it had decent facilities and was spotlessly clean. The hotel has 2 different sections - we were in 'Gravina 2' - this part would not be suitable for people with mobility problems. There are lifts but still several steps to deal with. The service we received was excellent , the staff were all very friendly and helpful with a good understanding of English. There is 24 hour free internet with printing facilities based in the lobby. We would strongly recommend paying the extra to include the breakfast buffet - the food was excellent. I wouldn't bother paying extra for the luxury upgrade - the bathrobes, bottle of cava and 'nice suprise' (chocolates) kind of paled into insignificance when you see the tapas bars and patisseries! The best thing about this hotel was the fantastic location... turn right and you are at Place Catalunya and a 2 min walk from La Ramblas and turn left and you straight into the gothic quarter. There is the metro and aeroport bus stop right at the top of the street that the hotel is on. Perfect.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent value, excellent service, excellent rooms”
Reviews.Author: Trembling_Turnip
Reviews.Content: Booked this hotel on the basis of Tripadvisor reviews and our stay was excellent. The double room was great, quite spacious and very clean with large double bed, satellite tv, minibar, safe, and good ensuite that included shower, bath, bidet etc. Our room also had a relatively large outside terrace where we enjoyed drinking our complimentary bottle of cava on our first night! The hotel is central to Barcelona's main areas (very near Las Ramblas etc and about a 15 minute walk to the marina) but we could not hear any noise from our room. The staff here were very helpful and spoke excellent English. They helped us to book taxis, a dinner reservation and get to the bus stop for our flight home! The only complaint I would have is that the noise between rooms is a bit of a pain. There was also an odd drain smell like cauliflower that seemed to permeate through the room in the morning. Whether this was a problem with the hotel or Barcelona's sewage system itself, I do not know. But in general I found this to be a great hotel; really good value for money, excellent rooms, great location and a first class level of customer service. I would definitely stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “Ideal location, efficient, comfortable and friendly.”
Reviews.Author: Blakkar
Reviews.Content: Because it was well reviewed in Tripadvisor, my wife and I booked this hotel for a 4-night stay in Barcelona. It completely lived up to our expectations and in many ways exceeded them. The staff were extremely friendly and helpful, the cleanliness was exemplary, the beds were comfortable and the room was well-appointed. At our request our room was changed from the allocated interior room to a "superior con balcon" overlooking the street, which was mostly reasonably quiet except one night when the street-cleaners decided to pressure-wash their bins at 4.30 am. Still at least we felt we were in touch with the city, and it was nice to have proper daylight and even a balcony on which to sit if you're not prone to vertigo (like most of those in Barcelona the rail is only hip-high). The hotel's situation is ideal for exploring the city on foot. It's a mere five minutes' walk from Catalunya Plaza and La Rambla - even for a couple of seniors like us. (Tip: if eligible, ask for senior tickets at the various sites - there's a big saving!). The Metro is also very close by (Universitat). An airport bus drop-off is about 100m away, though you have to go to the far side of Catalunya Plaza for the return pick up. Book this hotel with confidence.

Reviews.Title: “Good Hotel”
Reviews.Author: NottinghamArchie
Reviews.Content: Arrived in Barcelona and used the Aerobus from Airport to centre. Good regular service and cheap. The hotel was 4 minutes walk from the Place de Catalunya square stop. It is situated down a side street so was very quiet. Arrived at check in and was offered a glass of champagne whilst we checked in. All hotel staff were friendly and attentive throughout our 4 day stay. Booked bed only and on arrival was offered a voucher giving 50% off the 15 euro price for breakfast. Tried it the first day, was ok, some fruit, cereal, bacon, cakes etc. 7.5 euro was about the right price. Found better value/quality outside the remaining days. The hotel is fairly basic but was very clean and the beds were comfortable. Would stay here again, quiet, clean, friendly and good location.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent location, friendly staff”
Reviews.Author: GeoffLevett
Reviews.Content: I travelled with my two sons, aged 7 and 10. We arrived early morning after having travelled to Barcelona by the overnight train from Paris. I didn't expect to be able to check into the room and didn't have to ask the staff if we could leave our luggage with them while we went out for the day - they offered to do it unprompted. The hotel is very close to the metro station (Universitat) and therefore it is easy to get around, and in fact you can walk to many attractions within 10 minutes. The room was clean and quite spacious, the window opened on to a wall but who goes to Barcelona to sit in their room ? Free wireless internet access is available to all customers, which is an excellent offer when you're on a long trip. The public area was very nice to sit in while waiting for friends to get ready. We had breakfast, which was good though a little more expensive than if you went to one of the many local cafés. We also dined there the first evening because we were too tired to go out and find somewhere else. The food was excellent value - around four courses and a free aperitif for less than 20 euros per head, with very good service. We were travelling on to the Pyrenees for a week before returning to Barcelona and I was happy to book the Gravina for a night on the way back to Paris. The hotel gave me a complimentary bottle of Cava for re-booking with them, which was a nice touch. Our room on the return leg was a little bit noisy, we were in the newer part of the building, but it didn't bother me overly much. Overall I thought the Gravina was good value for money if you want a no stress place to stay in Barcelona.

Reviews.Title: “Deeply Average”
Reviews.Author: itstartshere
Reviews.Content: Steeped in averageness. That's how I'd sum up this place. Like many, I did a fair amount of research to find a reasonably priced (try the Grupotel corporate site for lowest rate) central 3*. Was I disappointed? Midly. What i liked - *They speak english and are helpful *The room size was not as small as I'd been fearing based on the reviews here. We also enjoyed the view from a small balcony. *Bathroom is a decent size (a small tub mind you) *Clean hotel and well maintained. What i didn't like - *The wireless internet never worked. not once. Lots of range, but no internet connection. I'm fairly techhy and have an up-to-date laptop (managed to slip onto a neighbouring wireless network but very slow) No additional help from the staff here on this. There was one working terminal for guest use in the lobby, but in constant use. *The sulphur-y drains. Everytime we came back to the room we feared those boiled-egg-like smells. Bring some kind of air freshener perhaps. *The thin walls. Was not a constant problem, but they are not totally soundproofed and you will hear your neighbours. *Heat issues. A/C not working (bare in mind it was a shoulder season though, so probably not 'switched on') Had to leave windows open until the traffic started in the morning. Bottom line: You could do a lot worse than this hotel. But by the same token you could do better. And given you're the picky sort who is bothering to research his/her hotel, then perhaps you should...

Reviews.Title: “Very nice central hotel”
Reviews.Author: EMC144
Reviews.Content: As this was our first visit to Barcelona, I spent some time researching hotels before booking this one. I booked partly due to the recommendations on Tripadvisor. I was not disappointed. It was reasonably priced for a 3 star hotel, an easy 5 minute walk from the Plaza Catalunya at the top of Las Ramblas. It is also close to the Universitat metro station which will connect you to the rest of the city with ease. On arrival, the staff were efficient and thankfully spoke English much better than our few words of Spanish. We were also welcomed with a glass of Champagne - a very nice touch. They were also able to give us some advice on sightseeing and bus trips we could take. The room was very clean, with a lovely balcony overlooking the street at the front of the hotel. There was plenty of wardrobe space and the bathroom was large. Overall, I would have no hesitation in recommending this hotel to other travellers looking for a mid-priced, central hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Good location but small rooms”
Reviews.Author: JennyLea
Reviews.Content: There were five of us in our party; two couples and a single female (age 50-60). We had two doubles and a single room for 4 nights. The location of Hotel Gravina was very good, being a short walk from Catalunya Square and Las Ramblas, so we were close to tour bus stops, shopping, bars and restaurants. The hotel offered a hearty breakfast (self-service) which was 16 euros, and although we felt it was quite expensive, it was worth it as there was a choice of juice, cereals, fruit, pastries, ham and cheeses to a full English breakfast. The only downside to our stay was the size of our bedrooms in the hotel. None of us has ever stayed in a room so small (410, 310 and 621 which was in another building). There was barely enough space for my husband and I to pass each other at the side of the bed which, in all of our rooms, was placed right up against the wall, each room having a tiny wardrobe and no drawers. The double rooms were more like single rooms and the single room was even smaller. We were all very disappointed. The hotel was mainly full, so we were told there was no opportunity to move. We would recommend that, if possible when booking, you ask for the larger double rooms or a suite and definitely not rooms as numbered. Rooms 310 and 410 were also affected by noise of the nearby lift late at night and room 621 was prone to occasional bad smells. The bathrooms were mainly marble, modern and a good siize, and everything was very clean. The 2 day tourist bus pass was good value and enabled us to see some spectacular views of Barcelona. We marvelled at the Gaudi architecture, loved the Spanish Village and spent a couple of long, relaxing, lunches enjoying the fresh fish and Paella at the Port Velle restaurants.

Reviews.Title: “great hotel”
Reviews.Author: missbrodie
Reviews.Content: Stayed here for 4 nights, Monday to Friday. Great location, airport bus stops nearby, Plaza Catalunya and Ramblas 5 mins walk. The room we had was at the front but we weren't disturbed by noise. Room was smallish but adequate and very clean, beds very comfortable. Hotel staff very friendly and approachable. Didn't have breakfast but did eat there one night. Not much atmosphere but food good and reasonable in price.

Reviews.Title: “Great position, reservation on room size”
Reviews.Author: Ian
Reviews.Content: Just returned from a 4 night stay at this hotel. Location is fantastic, 5 mins from catalunya square, and a 10 min direct walk to the centre of the Ramblas from the rear of the hotel. Major down size is the size of the rooms, we had 109 and this was very small (bed up against one wall), asked to change but hotel full. No air con on so room very hot, hotel did provide fan but it did little to help. (temp 16 to 18 cent). Bathroom excellent and room well cleaned. Breakfast was to first rate could not fault range on offer, would cover most people's needs. Like some other reviews we did experience smell of drains (especially outside room in corridors), but had taken air fresheners with us in light of other reviews. 800 metres from the university so on a night area really buzz's, full of bars, restuarants. Hotel situated on a quite 400 metre road, 400 metres from the nearest underground. Hotel ideal on location but room sizes mean not ideal unless you wish only to sleep in your room, as we were out from 9am to midnight apart from changing for night, not a problem.

Reviews.Title: “Good Hotel”
Reviews.Author: els37
Reviews.Content: This is a great hotel, really central, just round the corner from Placa Catalunya and the Ramblas but on a side street so not noisy. On arrival we were given a complimentary glass of champagne, (always a good start!) and the staff were helpful and polite. Rooms were a good size, bathrooms were clean and functional. Well stocked minibar not too expensive. Had a 2 course meal here one night, food was fine and got free bottled water and aperitif all for 14euros, so not expensive. It was a really nice place to stay and so handy for the main square etc. Wouldn't have any hesitation in recommending it and would stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel - friendly staff - Recommended”
Reviews.Author: USAIndytravels
Reviews.Content: Feb 17th, 2007: Arrived to find friendly staff who informed us of a problem with electricity. They had to move us to the Hotel Rambla Catalunya about a block away for one night. This new hotel was VERY nice to say the least. Upon returning to the Gravina the next day, the staff was very cordial and offered us free breakfast and no charge for safe key and free coffee and drinks for the inconvenience. Our room was just fine with a nice balcony overlooking a fairly quiet street and a pretty church to the left. Had nice terry robes and a letter of appology left due to the inconvenience earlier. The lobby, room and breakfast area were all spotless. The bathroom was nice, all marble and plenty of hot water and good pressure. The beds were comfortable but not fantastic. The location was almost ideal for just about any traveller. Very close to Metro and Ramblas. Breakfast was wonderful. Couple of nice restaurants in the area. Gothic neighborhood was easy walking distance. Had heard lots of reports of pickpockets. Had no problem but did hear a women screaming "Policia" in the night once. She apparently had her bag snatched. Just use common sense as in an other large city. Barcelona was wonderful and so was the Gravina. Would definately recommend for budget consious travellers. Good value for the money.

Reviews.Title: “A nice surprise”
Reviews.Author: marshall78
Reviews.Content: I booked this hotel on the hotels web-site after reading other reviews here on the Tripadvisor pages. The Grupotel Gravina Hotel (not H10 any more) was a great 3 star hotel. The hotel is situated a three minute walk from Pl. Universitat and five minutes by foot to Pl.Catalunya at the top of the Rambla. The room included a minibar, a big bathroom compared to other European hotels, a kettle (although you had to buy your teabags or coffee at the hotel bar if you did not nick any at breakfast), and a wardrobe. We had a double bed that was a bit hard, but I slept very well. Our room was in the newer part of the hotel, Gravina II, but you had to walk a long way to get there. First into a lift, up two floors, turn right, up a small staircase, turn left, then right, another lift up two more floor and then to the right again. No problem for us, but not great if you are carrying a lot of baggage, a pushchair or whining children. The staff was very helpful. They spoke good English, recommended good restaurants (Celler Tapas one block up was a good choice) and the room was very clean. Breakfast also very good with a good variety of hot and cold food and cakes. Conclusion; A very good experience. I would recommend this hotel to my friends and colleagues. A tip: Always check all hotels official website for prices before booking on the net. (“Google” the name and you will most probably find it). How to get there from the Airport (copied from a mail the hotel sent me when I requested directions): The best three ways to arrive from the airport are: Taxi: It costs about 25 €. It takes 20-30 minutes. Bus: There is a special bus called Aerobus (blue bus with yellow writing on it). It leaves from the airport every 15 minutes. It costs 4 € per person. It is comfortable and fast (it will also take 20-30 minutes). You must stop in Gran Via - Plaça Universitat (which is the third stop). The hotel is 150 meters from that point. (get of bus, walk down Pelai and turn right when you are opposite the Jazz Hotel) Last Bus is at 24hs. Train: There is a train that lives from the airport every 15 minutes. It costs around 2,5 €uros per person. It takes around 25 minutes. You must stop in Catalunya; the Hotel is 5 minutes walking from Catalunya Square. Last train lives around 23.40hs.

Reviews.Title: “Charm and Character, with a classy lobby”
Reviews.Author: rro
Reviews.Content: When I arrived at this hotel, I thought it was quite elegant. The exterior stone work was elaborate, and up kept. Inside, marble and clean lines. I was immediately impressed. The lobby looked like it could be part of New York. Sleek, and clean, yet inviting. Past that, the hotel picked up some charm, with its painted wood trim. My room, and the neighbouring rooms were all similar. The rooms were tight, but space is always a premium in large cities. The bathrooms is where they blew the budget. New marble everything. The breakfast the next morning was elaborate, and the setting was modern and clean. I enjoyed this aspect very much.

Reviews.Title: “Ideal for budget travellers!!!”
Reviews.Author: ramone2309
Reviews.Content: We were seven guys from Liverpool, England. Booked into three rooms. This hotel was previously a Best Western - so you should get an idea of the size and amenities. Staff were all very helpful and the breakfasts was a very nice hot/cold buffet. Minutes from the top of Las Ramblas and the Tourist bus stops. Would recommend this place highly to all and everyone on a budget who just needs a place to sleep and freshen up. Which is all you should really need from a hotel anyway!. Excellent choice Ramone Liverpool, England.

Reviews.Title: “Very nice hotel”
Reviews.Author: solandmar
Reviews.Content: I stayed in this hotel for 8 nights and really enjoyed my stay there! A great location, very nice and clean room with fresh flowers and everything you could need there. The stuff was also very nice and friendly, so i just can give the hotel 5 from 5! next time if i need a hotel in Barcelona, i will try to find a good deal in Gravina hotel. Lana

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel”
Reviews.Author: sydneybrightongirl
Reviews.Content: My Boyfriend and I stayed here for 3 nights mid week in November and we had a great time! To be fair we are not overly fussy travellers, all I expect is cleanliness, polite and helpful staff and if possible a good location, and the Gravina delivered all of these. I was quite dubious about booking as I'd read many varying reviews of Barcelona hotels...The Gravina was very clean, had lovely large bathroom with a fabulous shower and breakfast was amazing, I've never seen anything like it! Full hot breakfast, as well as fruit, cold meats, cheeses, cereal, toast, cakes etc. The room was clean, and we were lucky to have a large terrace. The only downside of the place is that depending on where you stay you may have to take two lifts to get to your room. It's a bit of a maze, but for people without walking difficulties it would not be an issue, and we managed to find our way back each night, even after much rioja. The location could not have been better, only a few minutes from the ramblas & catalunya, but in a quieter part of town with some great little bars & cafes very close by. I would definitely stay here again on my next trip to Barcelona.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel for the price.”
Reviews.Author: BB2Glasgow
Reviews.Content: My wife and I had a most enjoyable stay last week - five nights Between Christmas and New Year. Location is VG - three mins walk from La Rambla / Placa Catalunya. If you are coming from the airport on the bus then get off at Universitat Plaza and its 100 metres away. Hotel is small but public areas clean and welcoming. Enjoy the free champagne when you check in! Staff were most helpful and there was free internet access. Breakfast was in a basemnt room but it was well furnished. Food was quite varied and we had no complaints about either quality or service. Gets a bit busy about 9.30am. Room was a bit small but was clean , modern and comfortable. Happy to recommend this place.

Reviews.Title: “superb hotel, if only the beds were better”
Reviews.Author: EvG
Reviews.Content: The H10 Gravina is really easy to reach from Barcelona Airport with the Aerobus (€ 3,75) to Placa Catalunya, in about 35 minutes. From there it's a 5 minute walk. The location of the hotel is good, within walking distance of the Ramblas and old town. Check-in at the reception is done friendly and efficiently, and with a complimentary glass of Cava, which you can take to your room. The room (#202) was very clean, with a spacious bathroom, and TV, telephone, minibar, and a safe which you can rent seperately for €2 a day. No spectaculair view, but quiet at night, even with window open. Housekeeping was perfect. Breakfast was simply excellent, staff was friendly and a large buffet with great variety of bread, sausages, scrambled egg, meats and cheeses, juices, fruit and cakes. My only complaint (but not unimportant) was that the beds are NOT of the same standard as the rest of the hotel. Hard springs inside the bed made my back hurt. So if you're a difficult sleeper and/or prefer soft matrasses, consider staying elsewhere. Otherwise H10 Gravina is a solid choice.

Reviews.Title: “Quiet central position”
Reviews.Author: Iris
Reviews.Content: We had four nights bed and breakfast in this well-situated 3 star hotel.We were not offered cava at the check-in desk although it was there in front of us.We didn't mind as we are not overly fond of cava.Anyway it was there for all at breakfast if we had wanted. Our room 620 was small but had the useful addition of a terrace.I asked for a balcony but that was not available.The terrace was lovely although the view was pretty nondescript.Rooms 620 and 621 are in the annexe and have the useful terraces but 622 and 623 must be awfully cramped as they do not have that facility. Breakfast was good with a fine selection of cold meats and a limited hot buffet.Cakes were gorgeous and juices were delicious.Good quality coffee and delightful service from very p[leasant staff.Free Internet access in the foyer was welcome. The hotel is on a quiet side street but only 5 minutes walk from the Ramblas.Desk staff were courteous and helpful.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful Small Hotel”
Reviews.Author: Grnwayrob
Reviews.Content: We stayed at this hotel for 3 days in late September and were very impressed. First, the staff were all exceedingly courteous and friendly. They were always happy to answer questions, and even allowed us a late check-out of 2pm. There are two teensy tiny elevators, which can only only fit 2 people. The room we had was in the main hotel on the back of the top floor (5). Very quiet, though not much of a view. The street the hotel is located on is only 1 block long, so even front facing rooms would be quiet at night. Our room contained 2 twin beds pushed against each other, along with a desk, then a small separate sitting area with a sofa and coffee table, along with a full closet. The bathroom was all marble. The shower had great water pressure and there was always plenty of hot water. Location of the hotel was also great, just a five minute walk to Plaza Catalunya and the top of the Ramblas, or about 3 minutes to Plaza Universitat with the metro station and many restaurants. Would stay here again in a heartbeat!

Reviews.Title: “The great champagne welcome”
Reviews.Author: diveguru
Reviews.Content: I have stayed in many hotels in and around Barcelona and this was by far the best yet. Remarkable service, great charm and helpful staff at the front desk. Clean rooms with great maid service. The bedding could use an upgrade. A little thin for my tastes. Good location walking distance for tourist attractions and lots of great bars and restaurants just around the corner. The champagne welcome was a nice touch. Very helpful English speaking concierge as well.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful hotel”
Reviews.Author: Stu-type
Reviews.Content: We've just come back from a 4-night stay at the Gravina and have to say it was a memorable experience. The staff were excellent, friendly and accomodating, and went out of their way a number of times. We were in a sixth floor room in Gravina 2 (620) which had its own balcony that we made full use of. The room was at the end of the corridor which meant it was quiet and plenty big enough for our needs. It was cleaned daily - in fact the whole hotel was pretty spotless. The location of the hotel is ideal and very close to the tube stations, but equally in easy walking distance of Las Ramblas and many other attractions - and of course there are loads of them in Barca. It was easy to wander out of the hotel at night time too, and it was certainly safe. We'd recommend a visit to the Sagrada Familia and the Magic Fountain - they were amongst the highlights of our trip. Also Pi square was pretty cool and a great place to chill out. Avoid - the Port Olimpic area for food, unless you want to get chaved up and watch Brits abroad! This wasn't our taste, as was the paella down there! We did eat well at Biocenter on Carrer Pintor Fortuny, and Mama Cafe on Doctor Dou. (And only one of us was a vegetarian - both were equally excellent.) We had no problems with pickpockets, and we found almost everyone to be very friendly.

Reviews.Title: “Loved Barcelona”
Reviews.Author: Pipcosta
Reviews.Content: We recently spent 8 wonderful days in Barcelona (28th of June to 5th of July). During this trip we stayed 3 nights at the H10 Gravina, and 4 nights at the H10 Marina. We were fortunate to stay in magnificent rooms (suites) at each hotel. The hotels are both excellently located, clean and comfortable. The staff are friendly, professional , and eager to please. The breakfast at the Gravina is very good, and world class at the Marina. Based on this experience we now intend where possible to use the H10 group when we visit Spain. Just a few points that may help fellow traveller: To keep the room cooler, keep the curtains/sun screens closed during the day. Removing the bedspreads and blankets also makes sleeping more comfortable. There is air conditioning but in the height of summer do not expect artic temperatures. Spend a whole day at the Montserrat Monastery. Public transport is clean, efficient, and cheap. We saw no evidence of the reported crime, but with as with all major cities take precautions. There are some great, mediocre, and terrible restaurants. We had three great dinners at the El Rey De La Gamba fish restaurant on the Olympic Marina front. It would have been four but they close on Mondays. That night we had the misfortune of experiencing our only truly terrible meal of the trip. We had returned very tired from Montserrat and ignored our rule of never using restaurants that use sales people to drum up business. Visit the food market half way along the Rambala. Here you will all find a great fish place (open till 5 pm). It has on twelve seats around the serving counter. You will often see two or three people queuing behind each seat. The food is that good.

Reviews.Title: “Beware the standard room”
Reviews.Author: mashaman
Reviews.Content: Just returned from a week at Gravina. Mostly good things to say with one exception - beware the STANDARD ROOM. They are extremely small and all face small airshafts. You couldn't walk around the bed and it was impossible to tell if it was day or night outside. Although the rate was the best in Barcelona, our stadndard room was so small that we were forced to upgrade to an exterior room. This cost an extra 30 euros, which still made it a good deal for a much larger room with a balcony. However, you might find comparable rooms in other hotels at this greater rate. The staff was friendly, the place was very clean, and an excellent location but I do seriously recommend the superior room.
