Also, if you have trouble walking make sure you tell them, as a large protion of the hotel is in a new wing that requires a long hike.

Reviews.Title: “Comfortable hotel in a great location for exploring the city.”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: Have just returned from a very enjoyable 3 night citybreak. Hotel is clean and comfortable and in a great location on a quiet side street just 5 minutes from the top of The Ramblas. Very central for walking and exploring all aspects of the city. Staff were helpful and friendly - breakfast offered something for everyone. The welcoming drink of Cava was a nice touch! We ate in the hotel on our first night. The set meal was good but the restaurant lacked atmosphere. The following nights we ate out - loads of choice nearby - and the hotel staff were happy to recommend. Would definitely recommend / stay at this hotel again.

Reviews.Title: “Great Location”
Reviews.Author: bridni
Reviews.Content: Clean hotel Friendly Staff Champagne on arrival! Good Breakfast Not really geared up for dinners - we were only ones who ate there the first night. However they do recommend nice restaurants Location is brill Would certainly recommend as a base for a weekend sight seeing in Barcelona

Reviews.Title: “Another Good H10”
Reviews.Author: gss517
Reviews.Content: I stayed at this hotel based on another H10 property I stayed at before. The hotel has two parts old and new and the Gravina II was a little confusing to get to but enough signs to find your way. However the room (#524)we got was horrible. There was water damage all over the walls and smell wasn't very pleasant and the heater wasn't working so we asked to change rooms. They gave us #324 but same thing. They offered us extra blankets but we were a bit irritated now, then finally they found us a room #322 which was perfect. Only had one double instead of the two twins we requested, but I was staying with my mom so it didn't matter. After our room saga was over I have nothing but nice things to say about the hotel. Free internet is always a plus!!! The was staff was really helpful and always recommended an good place to eat. Besides the room issue I would definitely stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “Bagain little hotel”
Reviews.Author: JoeyEmma
Reviews.Content: Just got back from a two night stay here. The hotel was in a great location, within walking distance from all the main Old City attractions. The staff were helpful and the room clean, tidy and decorated well. Only niggle was that we were in the "new part" which consisted of a lift to the second floor, walk along a corridor and up another two flights of stairs. The room overlooked an ugly courtyard and didn't have a courtyard, which didn't bother us in winter, but I'm sure if it had been hot summer it would have been a pain. Oh, and our room was in the no smoking corridor that had an ash tray next to the lift and two in the room, although you couldnt actually smell any cigarettes.

Reviews.Title: “Just what we wanted”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: Just spent 2 nights here on the occasion of my partner´s 30th. Wanted something a bit special, but that would not break the bank. Chose the hotel on the basis of reviews on this site, and it exceeded my expectations. Got the customary glass of Cava on arrival from the very friendly reception staff. Were also treated to a complimentary platter of fruit as it was a special occasion. Our room was on the 2nd floor, above the reception and had a balcony looking over the street. Was an adequate size and had a lovely bathroom with various toiletries provided. Was very impressed by the bathrobes left on our bed after the maids came to turn down our beds! Location was perfect: less than 10 minutes walk to La Rambla and the thick of things. Was really impressed by all aspects of the hotel, in comparison to various other "3star" hotels in Italy and France.

Reviews.Title: “Does the job”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: Stayed 5 nights and found the hotel adequate. The hotel lacks any flair or soul but provides a quiet place with reasonable comfort. Breakfast is good with plenty of food and choice but there is limited space so you have to be down before 9am to avoid queuing. Rooms vary in size and I wouldn't have been happy with the small rooms at the side. Staff are very helpful and polite. Position is good for all the major site seeing: about 5 minutes walk to Placa de Cataluyna and Las Ramblas. If you stay here you won't have any real complaints but then again you won't come back raving about how wonderful the hotel was.
